Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Avant Arte

Avant Arte is a curated marketplace that makes discovering and collecting art radically more accessible for a new generation. Our team of passionate experts collaborate with leading contemporary artists from across the globe to create bespoke limited-edition artworks to browse and collect. We began as a cult blog of contemporary artists and since 2015 we've grown our community to over 3.3 million strong across more than 100 countries. We're proud to collaborate with leading contemporary artists to create limited edition works - from sculpture editions and works on paper to NFTs and hand-finished silkscreen prints.

OUR CULTURE

Were a small team with really big ambitions, both for what we want to achieve and also the environment were building. We want to create a company that remains thoughtful as we scale and tries to be genuinely progressive in how we operate. We want people to really own what they do and be given the autonomy and freedom to make mistakes, learn, and create something meaningful.

We all work incredibly hard because we really care about what Avant Arte is here to do were looking for exceptional people who are proactive, hungry to learn, and want to put their pride in our collective achievements.

We know that creating an inclusive environment that promotes and values diversity is critical if we want to build something with impact and meaning. We believe that having diversity in age, background, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity, and perspective will make us an infinitely better company. We were shortlisted for Women in Techs Best Employer - Small Company and Best Benefits, and Ottas top 100 startups to work at.

What We Need

Were looking for a full-stack data analyst. We really do encourage everyone to proactively step outside of their job description if they see something that could be improved but the core of your role will involve:

Data infrastructure - (provide overall activity e.g. artist research and outline details below subheading)


Own and maintain data models in dbt, upholding high standards for clarity, performance, and documentation
Write clear, efficient SQL (and occasionally Python) for both ad hoc analyses and scheduled reporting


Business reporting


Partner with teams across the business to define, implement and maintain business reporting frameworks
Work closely with different functional partners to level up our teams access to data and enhance our self-serve data infrastructure


Insights and analyses


Conduct deep-dive analyses to answer key business questions and surface new opportunities
Share insights through crisp, accessible storytelling, tailoring outputs as appropriate for both technical and non-technical audiences


Data strategy


Contribute to the development and maintenance of Avant Artes long-term data strategy
Work closely with different stakeholders to build and manage a pipeline of impactful data initiatives


The Main Skills Were Looking For Are


Proficient in SQL and experienced using dbt for analytics engineering
Comfortable with dashboarding toolsMetabase preferred, but Looker or Tableau is great too
Strong grasp of how to define, measure, and track meaningful metrics
Curious, self-directed, and passionate about telling clear, compelling stories with data


We Think Youll Probably Have


24 years of experience in a data, analytics, or similar role
Familiarity with e-commerce, digital content, or the creative industries is a plus
A love of art and culture isnt requiredbut definitely encouraged


Dont meet every single requirement? Avant Arte is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic team so we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Benefits Include


Generous equity allowance
Private Healthcare (UK)
Enhanced pension contributions and parental leave policies
25 days of holiday plus four extra company wide days
L&D budget of ‚Ç¨1000 per year per employee
Regular company socials
Art loan scheme for employees

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Role: Data Analyst




Salary: ¬£50k - ¬£70k




Skillset: BigQuery, GCP, Python




Location: Bromley, South East London




Working Pattern: Hybrid




Overview

A brand new role has opened up for an experienced Data Analyst to join an exceptional businesses within the reward sector. The company are experiencing a huge period of growth with exciting plans to continue this upwards trajectory.




You‚Äôll will be tasked to enhance the company‚Äôs business intelligence and data solutions by uncovering insights to support the business commercially, and inform business decisions. They are looking for someone who keen to roll up their sleeves, and has a proactive mindset.




The role is being offered on a permanent basis from their South-East London office, on a hybrid basis.




The Company

The business provide a premium service to their clients. Their mission is to provide their customers with fantastic opportunities only available through their exclusive services.




As a new team member you will be joining a vibrant team of specialists who truly care about the work that they do. In addition to joining a great team of professionals, you‚Äôll get access to a wonderful benefits headlined by 22 days holiday + bank holidays, performance reward schemes, pension plans, training opportunities, company equipment and development opportunities.




The Role

The ideal candidate will have a 3+ years‚Äô experience under their belt and be an analytical and proactive thinker who is keen to get stuck in! You‚Äôll be joining a company that genuinely love the work they do, so they would love a fellow data enthusiast to be joining them. You will play a crucial role in:

Analyzing large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Develop, implement and optimize data models
Create and maintain dashboards and reports
Conduct Data Quality Assessments and Ensure Data Governance standards are being met
Provide end-user support when required




Essential Skills

BigQuery
Python
GCP
Working within a marketing context would be preferable




Benefits

22 Days Holiday + Bank Holiday
Memberships
Pension Contributions
Training and Career Progression
Hybrid Working




Next Steps

If you are a BI and Product Analyst and you are looking to work with an organisation that has a fantastic approach to work in a supportive an innovative environment, then look no further ‚Äì this is the role for you!




Referrals:

If this role isn‚Äôt right for you, do you know someone that might be interested? You could earn ¬£500 of retail vouchers if you refer a successful candidate to Oscar. Email: Rebecca.myers@oscar-tech.com to recommend someone for this role.




Interviews for this role will be held imminently . To be considered, please send your CV to me now to avoid disappointment.

Location: Bromley, South East London




Working Pattern: Hybrid

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Halian | Managed Services, Recruitment Agency & Contract Staffing
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with a good understanding in data modeling / data warehouse development, and business intelligence tooling to join my clients payments team, within the fintech space. This role is pivotal in building and optimizing data systems and pipelines that support analytics, reporting.




Key Responsibilities

Develop high-quality Power BI and Tableau dashboards, supporting business teams in making data-informed decisions.
Ensure data integrity, reliability, and performance through testing, monitoring, and documentation.
Exposure to Data Modelling and Warehousing would beneficial as you will need to build data models or migrate existing ones.
Drive best practices in data governance, metadata management, and data security.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our data platform and tooling.




Required Skills & Experience

3‚Äì5 + years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a FinTech or Payments environment.
Exposure and a good understansinf in data modeling (dimensional and normalized), ETL/ELT design, and data warehousing techniques.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with scripting languages such as Python or Scala.
Demonstrated ability to create impactful dashboards using Power BI and Tableau.
Deep understanding of data pipeline orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, dbt, Azure Data Factory).
Experience working in agile, cross-functional teams, collaborating closely with data analysts, engineers, and business stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and an ability to balance short-term fixes with long-term scalable solutions.




Nice to Have

Experience with real-time or streaming data (Kafka, Kinesis).
Familiarity with financial transaction data or payment processing systems.
Exposure to data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, PCI-DSS) and data security best practices




This role offers a 2 stage interview process and is required to work on site 3 days a week in central London.




Apply now to be considered!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Junior Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: ¬£35k‚Äì¬£40k (DOE)




Are you a detail-driven analyst with a passion for data and automation? Join a specialist investment firm that partners with some of the most exciting high-growth software companies across Europe and the US. In this dynamic role, you‚Äôll play a critical part in streamlining data-driven workflows and powering smarter investment decisions through innovative tech.




This is an exciting opportunity for an early-career analyst to join a growing Data & Research function that sits at the heart of the firm‚Äôs investment strategy. You'll be part of a high-impact team driving digital transformation and working with modern tools to improve processes, insights, and decision-making.




Your Responsibilities:

Build and enhance data pipelines: Help design and maintain proprietary automation systems that support investment strategy.
Improve internal platforms: Collaborate on projects to streamline workflows and eliminate manual processes using modern tooling.
Deliver high-quality insights: Monitor key data metrics and trends to support investment research and decision-making.
Ensure data integrity: Validate and enrich datasets to maintain accuracy, completeness, and consistency across internal platforms.
Evaluate tools and vendors: Assist in reviewing and optimising external data providers and technical solutions.
Contribute to innovation: Continuously explore opportunities to improve systems through experimentation, automation, and modern engineering practices.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM or data-oriented field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Economics.
A meticulous attention to detail and passion for accurate, high-quality data.
Interest in data automation and how technology enables smarter decision-making.
Exposure to or willingness to learn tools like Python, SQL, Zapier, n8n, or similar.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while delivering at pace.
Strong communication skills to collaborate across teams and share insights clearly with non-technical stakeholders.
A curiosity-driven mindset and eagerness to learn new technologies and data tools.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Experience with Google Cloud Platform, APIs, or GitHub.
Familiarity with structured data entry, validation processes, or workflow automation.
A genuine interest in private equity, venture capital, or financial technology.




The Benefits:

Join a mission-driven firm focused on supporting exceptional software companies.
Opportunity to work on impactful projects that shape investment outcomes.
Hybrid work model with a collaborative London-based team.
Mentorship and growth opportunities tailored to early-career talent.
Competitive salary and long-term progression within a growing data function.




If you're a motivated Junior Data Analyst eager to apply your skills in a fast-paced, tech-enabled environment, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now and be part of a team turning data into competitive advantage.

Title: TikTok LIVE Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities
The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touch-points to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in data analysis
- Strong mathematical skills to measure, collect, and analyze data
- Attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
- Proficiency in statistics and experience using data visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker
- Knowledge of SQL and any programming languages (Python is highly preferred)

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.‚Äã


Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.‚Äã
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.‚Äã
‚Äã
Diversity & Inclusion‚Äã
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.‚Äã

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Social Media Focus)

Location: Southwark, London

Working Model: Hybrid

Salary: ¬£35,000 - ¬£42,000 (depending on experience)




About Goat:

Goat is part of WPP Media (formerly GroupM), the world‚Äôs leading media investment company. Since 2015, we've been pioneers in influencer marketing, helping brands leverage the power of social media to achieve real, measurable results. Today, we stand as the global leader in the space, delivering award-winning campaigns across 70+ countries.




As part of our team, you'll collaborate with 500+ social natives worldwide, driving cutting-edge influencer campaigns for some of the most exciting brands. Whether it‚Äôs short-term activations or long-term ambassador programs, we treat influencer marketing as a full-funnel channel that drives awareness, engagement, and conversions.




About the Opportunity:

Our data-driven approach is built on insights from tracking over 100,000 influencers and campaign performance. We combine this with expert relationship management, social-first creative strategy, paid media, and advanced tracking, measurement, and optimisation to deliver results that matter.




We‚Äôre also proud to be recognised as a recipient of the ‚ÄòTop Employer Europe 2024‚Äô certification, underscoring our commitment to fostering a dynamic and supportive work environment. If you‚Äôre ready to be part of the team shaping the industry, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborating with Paid and Organic Campaign teams to deliver data-led strategies that optimise performance, improve efficiency, and enhance targeting across live campaigns.
Extracting, cleaning and analysing large-scale social media datasets to uncover patterns, trends and actionable insights that inform campaign planning and decision-making.
Working cross-functionally with campaign managers, strategists and creative teams to embed data-driven thinking throughout campaign execution.
Working with the Campaign Data team to ensure accurate data capture, storage and retrieval, while supporting the evaluation and implementation of tools to improve data workflows.
Communicating complex data findings clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences, including internal stakeholders and clients.
Continuously monitoring campaign performance, using data to assess effectiveness and recommend opportunities for ongoing optimisation.
Producing clear, insightful reports and dashboards highlighting key trends, performance metrics and strategic recommendations.
Supporting audience development and strategic planning from a data-first perspective, using segmentation and behavioural analysis.




Role Requirements:

Strong understanding of paid and organic social media, with an analytical mindset and a focus on performance.
Proven experience working with large datasets and translating findings into meaningful insights that inform strategy.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical data and analysis in a simple, engaging way.
Minimum of 2 years‚Äô experience in a social media or digital marketing environment, with a focus on analytics and reporting.




Company Culture and Benefits:

Regular social events and ongoing clubs
Provided MacBook laptop to work from
Flexi-hours
Hybrid Working
¬£200 grant to make your working from home set up comfortable once you‚Äôve passed probation
Health and wellbeing allowance once you‚Äôve passed probation
Health Insurance after you‚Äôve passed probation
Life Insurance Policy
25 Days Holiday plus bank holidays, accruing up to 30 days based on length of service
Birthday & Work Anniversary Days Off
Length of Service Gifts
In-Office Benefits such as beauty treatments & yoga
Flexible Bank Holidays
Volunteering Days
Free Flu Jabs




Plus many more!

Title: Junior Excel Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Excel Data Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid ‚Äì with global team collaboration)

Salary: up to ¬£45,000 + Benefits




Are you an Excel power user with a knack for automation and process improvement?

We‚Äôre hiring a proactive and technically skilled Excel Data Analyst to join a growing team within a high-performing, globally-connected Insurance services organisation.




This is a fantastic opportunity to modernise internal tooling and play a hands-on role in streamlining processes across international teams. You‚Äôll be a key player in evolving the way data is structured, analysed, and reported across the business.




What You‚Äôll Be Doing:

Data Analysis & Reporting

Clean, structure and analyse data from diverse sources
Apply statistical techniques to derive insights
Communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences
Conduct regular data quality checks and support data governance practices




Tooling & Automation

Build and maintain advanced Excel-based tools
Use macros and VBA to automate manual workflows
Assist in integrating tools with databases and external systems
Support ongoing Power BI dashboard development




Project & Process Support

Coordinate small internal projects and user requirements
Assist in writing user stories, test cases, and acceptance criteria
Apply structured problem-solving (e.g. pyramid principle, hypothesis-led design)
Deliver user training and documentation for tools developed

Tech Stack & Tools:

Advanced Microsoft Excel (including Macros and VBA)
Power BI (desirable)
SQL/database integration (advantageous)
Familiarity with data lake or cloud-based tools is a bonus




Ideal Candidate:

Strong Excel skills ‚Äì confident in macros, complex formulas, and VBA
A proactive problem-solver who enjoys driving process efficiencies
Excellent communicator, comfortable working across functions and regions
Organised, detail-oriented, and accountable for your own deliverables
Experience in financial services or insurance is a plus
Familiarity with Agile methodologies is helpful but not essential




What‚Äôs on Offer:

Competitive salary (¬£40‚Äì45K)
Hybrid working ‚Äì 2 days onsite in a central London location
A collaborative and values-led team culture
Exposure to global teams in Europe, Asia, and North America
Opportunities to shape and improve internal tools and workflows
A socially responsible business supporting causes globally through dedicated CSR efforts




Ready to make an impact with your Excel and automation skills?

APPLY NOW!!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world‚Äôs largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine‚Äôs Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

Available Locations: Lisbon, London

About The Team

The Business Intelligence team at Cloudflare is responsible for building a centralized cloud data lake and an analytics platform that enables our internal Business Partners and Product teams with actionable insights and also provides a 360 view of our business. Our goal is to democratize data, support Cloudflare‚Äôs critical business needs, provide reporting and analytics via self-service tools to fuel existing and new business critical initiatives.

Role Summary

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our London or Lisbon teams to scale our product analytics initiatives. You will partner closely with our product organization, analyzing a wide array of datasets to inform product team data requests ranging from routine reporting and ad hoc analysis, to long-term and strategic product roadmap-influencing projects.

Success in this role will rely on marrying a strong analytics background with product and business acumen to deliver highly strategic and compelling insights that accelerate our business growth and influence our product decisions.

Role Responsibilities


Provide analytics support, product understanding, and a strategic perspective to our product partners
Partner and align with data engineers, product managers, and other product stakeholders to enable data driven answers to key business problems
Take initiative and ask questions to iteratively define, build, and maintain business metrics and reports
Develop and automate data pipelines and reports to enable insights at scale
Weave stories with data to help stakeholders understand analytical insights



Role Requirements


B.S. or M.S in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative fields
3+ years of experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau and plotting libraries
Experience writing advanced SQL queries
Initiative, curiosity, and stakeholder engagement
Experience in translating business questions into analysis frameworks, converting the results into business recommendations, and presenting those recommendations back to business stakeholders
Knowledge of data management, data modeling and data warehousing fundamentals
Experience with statistical analysis programming languages (R, Python, etc.)



Nice-to-Have Skills


Experience and/or an understanding and keen interest in internet security
Experience with a fast-growing SaaS business based company preferred



What Makes Cloudflare Special?

We‚Äôre not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We‚Äôre a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare‚Äôs enterprise customers--at no cost.

Athenian Project: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.

1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here‚Äôs the deal - we don‚Äôt store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something you‚Äôd like to be a part of? We‚Äôd love to hear from you!

This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.

Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.
Show more
HTML:
About Us

At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world‚Äôs largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine‚Äôs Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

Available Locations: Lisbon, London

About The Team

The Business Intelligence team at Cloudflare is responsible for building a centralized cloud data lake and an analytics platform that enables our internal Business Partners and Product teams with actionable insights and also provides a 360 view of our business. Our goal is to democratize data, support Cloudflare‚Äôs critical business needs, provide reporting and analytics via self-service tools to fuel existing and new business critical initiatives.

Role Summary

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our London or Lisbon teams to scale our product analytics initiatives. You will partner closely with our product organization, analyzing a wide array of datasets to inform product team data requests ranging from routine reporting and ad hoc analysis, to long-term and strategic product roadmap-influencing projects.

Success in this role will rely on marrying a strong analytics background with product and business acumen to deliver highly strategic and compelling insights that accelerate our business growth and influence our product decisions.

Role Responsibilities

  • Provide analytics support, product understanding, and a strategic perspective to our product partners
  • Partner and align with data engineers, product managers, and other product stakeholders to enable data driven answers to key business problems
  • Take initiative and ask questions to iteratively define, build, and maintain business metrics and reports
  • Develop and automate data pipelines and reports to enable insights at scale
  • Weave stories with data to help stakeholders understand analytical insights


Role Requirements

  • B.S. or M.S in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative fields
  • 3+ years of experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau and plotting libraries
  • Experience writing advanced SQL queries
  • Initiative, curiosity, and stakeholder engagement
  • Experience in translating business questions into analysis frameworks, converting the results into business recommendations, and presenting those recommendations back to business stakeholders
  • Knowledge of data management, data modeling and data warehousing fundamentals
  • Experience with statistical analysis programming languages (R, Python, etc.)


Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Experience and/or an understanding and keen interest in internet security
  • Experience with a fast-growing SaaS business based company preferred


What Makes Cloudflare Special?

We‚Äôre not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We‚Äôre a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare‚Äôs enterprise customers--at no cost.

Athenian Project: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.

1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here‚Äôs the deal - we don‚Äôt store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something you‚Äôd like to be a part of? We‚Äôd love to hear from you!

This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst
Location: London (Hybrid - 2-3 days/week in office)
Salary: ¬£35,000

A well-established professional services firm is seeking a Junior Data Analyst to support its growing analytics and insights team. This is an ideal role for someone with a keen eye for data, looking to build a strong foundation in analytics within a collaborative, commercially focused environment.

The Role:
You'll work alongside experienced analysts and business stakeholders, helping to transform raw data into clear, actionable insights. From data preparation and cleaning to supporting dashboards and regular reporting, you'll play a key part in driving smarter decision-making across the business.

What You'll Be Doing:

Preparing, validating and analysing data from multiple internal systems

Assisting with the creation and maintenance of dashboards and regular reports

Supporting ad-hoc analysis and insight requests from across the business

Working closely with the senior analytics team to continuously improve data processes

What We're Looking For:

Strong Excel and data handling skills (SQL knowledge a plus)

A methodical, detail-oriented approach to working with large datasets

Some familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI or Tableau) is desirable

Eager to learn, with a genuine interest in using data to solve business problems

Quantitative degree from a leading university is essential

You'll be based in London 2-3 days a week, with flexibility around remote working. This is a great opportunity to start or build your career in a role where development and learning are encouraged.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Media help partners understand the changing advertising landscape. Specialising in audience measurement, consumer targeting and in-depth intelligence into paid, owned and earned media, their global coverage and local expertise enable better understanding of media audiences and their relationships with brands.

Kantar Media is a wholly owned but operationally independent part of the Kantar Group.

Job Details

As people increasingly move across channels and platforms, Kantar Media‚Äôs data and audience measurement, targeting, analytics and advertising intelligence services unlock insights to inform powerful decision-making.

Working with panel and first-party data in over 80 countries, we have the world‚Äôs fastest growing cross-media measurement footprint, underpinned by versatility, scale, technology and expertise, to drive long-term business growth for our clients and partners.

Job Title: Data Integration Analyst

Location: London

Work pattern: Full time/Permanent/Hybrid working

This is a full-time permanent position, based in our London office. We operate in a hybrid capacity and require 2 days in the office. All applicants must have the legal right to live and work permanently in the UK.

Role Description

Reporting to the Barb Research Director, the Dovetail Data Integration Analyst will work to deliver on Barb‚Äôs vision of an inclusive, audience-centric TV and video measurement that extends the scope of total viewing across content and advertising.

This role will combine data analysis and understanding of data science methodologies, leading on efforts to enhance our suite of audience reporting, including new Barb Panel Plus initiative which extends existing Dovetail reporting and combines fusion and calibration methodologies. In this role you will work closely with Barb, our stakeholders and data science and data integration teams to create clear briefs with the needs of the end client in mind, and participate in testing and implementation of developments, as well as reviewing test data. You will be involved in presenting data and testing findings to internal and external stakeholders and verifying client satisfaction with the product.

The Dovetail Data Integration Analyst will interface closely with the product teams working on fusion and calibration methodologies. You will work to ensure smooth hand-offs for internal developments and providing an essential quality to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the service.

As Dovetail Data Integration Analyst, you will be responsible for content reporting of online viewing on small screens and connected TVs. You will have a thorough understanding of the calculation methodologies and client file specifications to support the Data Science and Data Integration teams in development, but also to support the Client Service team in responding to end-user queries, as well as serving as an internal subject matter expert.

Key Responsibilities


Collaborating with stakeholders to identify new opportunities and working with internal teams to drive continuous improvement
Analyse, organize and present audience data in a clear and intuitive way, to derive actionable insights and recommendations
Prepare and present research findings, insights, and recommendations to key stakeholders and leadership teams.
Collaborate closely with data science, data integration, data operations and other stakeholders to develop specifications that have the end data user in mind
Serve as a subject matter expert on the Dovetail/Panel Plus file specifications and calculation methodologies, responding to internal and external queries
Establish a close and productive working relationship with the Barb executive and stakeholders, becoming a trusted advisor on audience measurement


Skills & Experience


Experience with multiple types of data ‚Äì panel data, census data
Experience and proficiency in the following:
Database management proficiency / SQL
Python (specifically for data analysis)
Data visualisation (Power BI)
Microsoft Office suite (Excel / PowerPoint)
Familiarity with cloud data platforms (Data Bricks, Snowflake)
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to control communication flows; Client facing experience is an advantage.
Numerate and analytical, comfortable with advanced mathematical and statistical concepts, with some understanding of marketing science analytics
Experience of data analysis/and or analysing large datasets, Developer Skills are advantage
Quick learner & self-starter who can use technical Forums when stuck with issues and willingness in investing time & effort to understand datasets associated with this domain.


Our offer

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear, and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that‚Äôs out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted, and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and wellbeing is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity; therefore, we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate because of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Privacy and Legal Statement

PRIVACY DISCLOSURE: Please note that by applying to this opportunity you consent to the personal data you provide to us to be processed and retained by The Kantar Group Limited (‚ÄúKantar‚Äù). Your details will be kept on our Internal ATS (Applicant Tracking System) for as long as is necessary for the purposes of recruitment, which may include your details being shared with the hiring manager(s) and for consideration for potential future opportunities by Kantar and its affiliate Kantar group companies. For full details of our privacy policy please visit www.kantar.com

Country

United Kingdom

Why join Kantar?

We pride ourselves on understanding people, and what makes us think and act the way we do.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We‚Äôre dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you‚Äôre not an exact match, we‚Äôd love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Apprentice Data Analyst
Description:
Salary: ¬£42,221
Grade: Level 3, Zone 2¬†
Location: 5 Pancras Square N1C 4AG¬†
Contract Type: Fixed Term/ Secondment for 28 months
Hours: Full Time (36 hours)¬†
Closing Date: Tuesday 26th August 2025; 23:59¬†¬†¬†

About Camden¬†

Camden is changing on the inside to make life better for everyone. Our residents and communities are at the heart of everything we do. We‚Äôre home to the most important conversations happening today and we‚Äôre making radical social change a reality, so that nobody gets left behind.¬† Here‚Äôs where you can help decide a better future for us all.¬†¬†

What You‚Äôll Be Doing¬†

This role will be split with 80% of your time helping shape the foundational data infrastructure of a front-line service in the early stages of its data maturity. While also spending 20% of your time studying for a level 7 apprenticeship in: Data Analytics with the university of West London.¬†

While working in the team you will be supporting the consolidation of multiple CRM systems into a new centralised platform. This will be the foundation for you to help develop self-serve analytical dashboards to deliver service insights and support evidence-based decision making. Develop, review and maintain reproducible analytical pipelines for various service needs. You will also have the opportunity to work with data from other areas to conduct analysis into Camden‚Äôs overall debt picture while also preparing responses to Freedom of Information requests. Staying informed with new technology and developing proof of concepts showcasing how their potential can improve service delivery.¬†¬†

While studying for your apprenticeship you can expect to cover modules in: Big Data Analytics, Machine Learning, Managing Innovation and Change while also completing an Apprenticeship Project. A full list of course details & modules can be found here.¬†

All About You¬†

As a Camden Apprentice Data Analyst prior data experience isn‚Äôt required, however you should be a data enthusiast committed to learning to develop your data and analytics skills across tools such as SQL, Python/R and Power BI.¬†¬†

You communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical colleagues, helping build a strong data culture and improving data literacy across the organisation. You‚Äôre creative and logical in solving problems, and your work supports service design, policy, and strategic planning. You also bring a solid grasp of project management, using these skills to assist on reporting, develop new analytical solutions, and contribute to continuous improvement.¬†

The requirements for the apprenticeship are a 2:2 honours in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) subject. Equivalent professional qualifications and/or relevant work experience may also be considered.¬†

If this opportunity appeals to you, and you feel you meet some even if not all the requirements, we encourage you to apply via the link below.

How To Apply¬†

To apply for this job please follow the "Apply" link. In the ‚ÄòWhy you?‚Äô section of the application you will be required to demonstrate how you meet the role criteria noted in the Job Profile under the ‚ÄúAbout You‚Äù section.¬†¬†

To view the Job Profile, please copy and paste the below URL into your browser:¬†
http://camdocs.camden.gov.uk/HPRMWebDrawer/Record/11144507/file/document?inline

What We Offer¬†

At Camden, you‚Äôll receive a host of benefits. From flexible working to 27 days annual leave (+ bank holidays!). We also know that a work life balance is extremely important so we also offer family leave, loan schemes and access to our incredible staff networks. We also have an incredible pensions scheme.¬†¬†

Visit 'www.camdenjobs.co.uk/staff-benefits' for more details.¬†

Inclusion and Diversity¬†¬†

We want Camden Council to be a great place to work and to ensure that our communities are represented across our workforce. A vital part of this is ensuring we are a truly inclusive organisation that encourages diversity in all respects, including diversity of thinking. We particularly welcome applications from Black, Asian and those of Other Ethnicities, LGBT+, disabled and neurodiverse communities to make a real difference to our residents so that equalities and justice remains at the heart of everything we do.¬†

We also encourage people historically underrepresented in STEM roles to apply for the position, even if you are not certain that you meet every criterion.¬†

To discover more about Camden and our commitment towards diversity, equality and safeguarding, please visit https://www.camdenjobs.co.uk/inclusion-and-diversity¬†¬†

Asking for Adjustments¬†¬†

Camden is committed to making our recruitment practices barrier-free and as accessible as possible for everyone. This includes making adjustments or changes for disabled people, neurodiverse people or people with long-term health conditions. If you would like us to do anything differently during the application, interview or assessment process, including providing information in an alternative format, please contact us on 020 7974 6655, at resourcing@camden.gov.uk or post to 5 Pancras Square, London, N1C 4AG,¬†

Anonymised Application‚ÄØ‚Äì‚ÄØin keeping with Camden‚Äôs commitment to inclusion the recruitment to this role is anonymised and supports the objective of reducing the impact of unconscious bias.¬†¬†

What You‚Äôll Be Doing 

This role will be split with 80% of your time helping shape the foundational data infrastructure of a front-line service in the early stages of its data maturity. While also spending 20% of your time studying for a level 7 apprenticeship in: Data Analytics with the university of West London. 

While working in the team you will be supporting the consolidation of multiple CRM systems into a new centralised platform. This will be the foundation for you to help develop self-serve analytical dashboards to deliver service insights and support evidence-based decision making. Develop, review and maintain reproducible analytical pipelines for various service needs. You will also have the opportunity to work with data from other areas to conduct analysis into Camden‚Äôs overall debt picture while also preparing responses to Freedom of Information requests. Staying informed with new technology and developing proof of concepts showcasing how their potential can improve service delivery.  

While studying for your apprenticeship you can expect to cover modules in: Big Data Analytics, Machine Learning, Managing Innovation and Change while also completing an Apprenticeship Project. A full list of course details & modules can be found here. 

All About You 

As a Camden Apprentice Data Analyst prior data experience isn‚Äôt required, however you should be a data enthusiast committed to learning to develop your data and analytics skills across tools such as SQL, Python/R and Power BI.  

You communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical colleagues, helping build a strong data culture and improving data literacy across the organisation. You‚Äôre creative and logical in solving problems, and your work supports service design, policy, and strategic planning. You also bring a solid grasp of project management, using these skills to assist on reporting, develop new analytical solutions, and contribute to continuous improvement. 

The requirements for the apprenticeship are a 2:2 honours in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) subject. Equivalent professional qualifications and/or relevant work experience may also be considered. 

If this opportunity appeals to you, and you feel you meet some even if not all the requirements, we encourage you to apply via the link below.

How To Apply 

To apply for this job please follow the "Apply" link. In the ‚ÄòWhy you?‚Äô section of the application you will be required to demonstrate how you meet the role criteria noted in the Job Profile under the ‚ÄúAbout You‚Äù section.  

To view the Job Profile, please copy and paste the below URL into your browser: 
http://camdocs.camden.gov.uk/HPRMWebDrawer/Record/11144507/file/document?inline

What We Offer 

At Camden, you‚Äôll receive a host of benefits. From flexible working to 27 days annual leave (+ bank holidays!). We also know that a work life balance is extremely important so we also offer family leave, loan schemes and access to our incredible staff networks. We also have an incredible pensions scheme.  

Visit 'www.camdenjobs.co.uk/staff-benefits' for more details. 

Inclusion and Diversity  

We want Camden Council to be a great place to work and to ensure that our communities are represented across our workforce. A vital part of this is ensuring we are a truly inclusive organisation that encourages diversity in all respects, including diversity of thinking. We particularly welcome applications from Black, Asian and those of Other Ethnicities, LGBT+, disabled and neurodiverse communities to make a real difference to our residents so that equalities and justice remains at the heart of everything we do. 

We also encourage people historically underrepresented in STEM roles to apply for the position, even if you are not certain that you meet every criterion. 

To discover more about Camden and our commitment towards diversity, equality and safeguarding, please visit https://www.camdenjobs.co.uk/inclusion-and-diversity  

Asking for Adjustments  

Camden is committed to making our recruitment practices barrier-free and as accessible as possible for everyone. This includes making adjustments or changes for disabled people, neurodiverse people or people with long-term health conditions. If you would like us to do anything differently during the application, interview or assessment process, including providing information in an alternative format, please contact us on 020 7974 6655, at resourcing@camden.gov.uk or post to 5 Pancras Square, London, N1C 4AG, 

Anonymised Application‚ÄØ‚Äì‚ÄØin keeping with Camden‚Äôs commitment to inclusion the recruitment to this role is anonymised and supports the objective of reducing the impact of unconscious bias.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Data

Location: London

Compensation: ¬£45,000 - ¬£60,000 / year



Description

Freetrade‚Äôs mission is to become the default place to invest. Investing has been too complicated and expensive for too long, keeping millions from making the most of their savings.

We‚Äôre changing that.

We‚Äôre building our team and looking for people who are excited to reshape how our customers invest and grow their wealth. If you‚Äôre driven by solving complex problems and building innovative products, you‚Äôll fit right in.

2025 is a big year for us. In January, we announced a game changing deal to become part of the IG Group. We‚Äôll continue to operate as an independent business while gaining access to the resources and support of an established leader in the space.

This year, we‚Äôre accelerating our roadmap and taking our products to the next level. We‚Äôre building new features like mutual funds, bonds, and family investment tools. We‚Äôre also exploring how we can leverage AI to deliver an even better experience for our customers.

Why join the Data team at Freetrade?

Data is at the core of how we make decisions, build products, and drive the business forward. This year, we‚Äôre scaling our data platform, refining self service analytics, and partnering across the business to tackle high impact projects. If you want to work on meaningful challenges where data turns into action, this role is for you.

Key Responsibilities


Define, implement, and maintain data marts, dashboards, and reports to monitor key business metrics and identify trends.
Collaborate with product, engineering, finance and ops teams to define data requirements and ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Perform in-depth analysis to uncover insights that drive strategic decisions and optimize business performance.
Develop and implement A/B tests and other experimental designs to measure the impact of new features and initiatives.
Promote data literacy across the organization.
Champion the adoption of data-driven decision-making and best practices throughout Freetrade.


About you


Solid experience with SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.
Confident, practical experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and creating compelling dashboards and reports.
Proven ability to connect KPIs and analysis to business outcomes, persuading stakeholders and using data to enhance decision-making quality across the company
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work with diverse teams and translate data insights into actionable recommendations.


Benefits

Freetrade is the place to accelerate your career. Our benefits package and ways of working are designed to attract and retain the most talented people who are dedicated to making an impact at Freetrade.

Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs on offer in 2025:

Hybrid working culture

We‚Äôre operating in a hybrid model: 3-days in-office / 2-days from home. We believe great collaboration happens in person and our beautiful offices in central London and Budapest are designed to bring people together.

üè¢ Office days: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday
üè° Work from home days: Wednesday, Friday

This setup helps us stay connected, collaborate more effectively, and keep building a culture where we all do our best work together, including dedicated days for focus work.

Flexibility for those who need it: We have a hybrid working model, but life happens. If you need flexibility let's talk about it, whether you're a parent or have other care responsibilities.

Values - at Freetrade we live and breathe our values: Honesty, Focus and Grit. Expect to be asked about these in your interview!

Benefits In London:
Competitive salary ‚Äì carefully benchmarked.
Holidays ‚Äì 25 days plus UK public holidays. Your birthday off, plus one extra day for every year at Freetrade.
Enhanced pension ‚Äì We‚Äôll match your contributions up to 5%.
Group Life Insurance ‚Äì Protect your loved ones with coverage at 5x your salary, ensuring financial security in any circumstance.
Private Health Insurance - Which includes access to high quality medical care, mental health support, dental and vision plans, Wellness programs and preventative care initiatives are also provided to ensure the wellbeing of your entire family.
Bonus Scheme - join us and share in our growth. Bonuses are linked to both company success and your individual impact.
First payouts: July 2026
Income Protection Cover ‚Äì Safeguard your income with comprehensive coverage, ensuring financial stability in the event of illness or injury.
Enhanced parental leave ‚Äì Time off when it matters most.
Flexibility for those who need it ‚Äì We‚Äôre office-first, but life happens. Whether you‚Äôre a parent or have care responsibilities, we focus on output and trust you to manage your time.
Learning & Development ‚Äì We fund industry qualifications so you can grow as a financial services professional.
Cycle to Work scheme ‚Äì Get a high quality bike and gear through our salary sacrifice scheme, spreading the cost with tax free monthly installments.
Paid Sick Leave ‚Äì Receive 10 days of fully paid sick leave each calendar year.
We are an Equal Opportunity employer committed to a diverse and representative team. Whatever your race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability - we want to hear from you.

To find out more about how we look after your personal data when you apply for a job with us, please see our Recruitment Privacy Policy here.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Welwyn Garden City, England, United Kingdom
Description:
About the role


We are currently recruiting a Data Analyst to work in our Business Support function to support Analysts, Project Managers and the wider team to improve efficiency in our distribution network.¬†


You will be responsible for

Delivering key metric reporting to support Project Managers
Translating business requirements and technical details into quality solutions and business language, whilst ensuring robust process maps and documentation
Working closely with the engineering team and follow agile practises to document requirements and acceptance criteria to deliver the data needs of Workload Labour Models
Increase availability of self-serve reporting for both internal and for the wider department
Data maintenance and report distribution
Helps deliver both descriptive and diagnostic reporting¬†

You will need

Sophisticated Excel (including VBA)
Previous experience using SQL (Desirable)
Good data visualisation and presentation skills (Tableau preferred)
Strong Analytical and numerical skills¬†
Desire to learn new skills and develop technical competence¬†
Curiosity of how data works in real world -¬†
Experience working with large datasets
Previously built requirement documents and/or process flow maps¬†

Whats in it for you?


We‚Äôre all about the little helps. That‚Äôs why we make sure our Tesco colleague benefits package takes care of you ‚Äì both in and out of work. Click Here to find out more!






Annual bonus scheme of up to 10% of base salary


Holiday starting at 25 days plus a personal day (plus¬†Bank holidays)


26 weeks maternity and adoption leave (after 1 years‚Äô service) at full pay, followed by 13 weeks of Statutory Maternity Pay or Statutory Adoption Pay, we also offer 6¬†weeks fully paid paternity leave


Free 24/7 virtual GP service, Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) for you and your family, free access to a range of experts to support your mental wellbeing



About Us


You might know us as a supermarket, technology company or even for our award-winning mobile network. Truth is, we‚Äôre all of those things, and much more. Our colleagues work with one goal in mind, helping to make every day a little better for our customers, colleagues and communities all over the world. No two customers are the same, neither are our colleagues.





At Tesco, we champion a balance that lets you thrive both in and out of work. Spend 60% of your week collaborating with colleagues at our office locations or local sites and the rest remotely. Whether you're just kicking off your career, juggling passions, or navigating big life events, we're here to support you. We always welcome a conversation about flexible working, so talk to us throughout your application about how we can support.





We're proud to be an accredited Disability Confident Leader, where everyone‚Äôs welcome. That‚Äôs why we commit to providing a fully inclusive and accessible recruitment process. If you need support with your application, click here for more information. And if you're interested in joining our team but don't tick every box, don't let that hold you back from applying

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Power BI

We're looking for a skilled Data Analyst - Power BI to join a thriving technology company in Staines. This role comes with outstanding benefits and flexible hybrid working options.




Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst - Power BI, your main responsibilities will include:

Designing, developing, and maintaining interactive Power BI dashboards and reports to deliver key financial and operational insights.
Connecting to various data sources (e.g., SQL databases, Excel, financial systems) and performing data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes within Power BI (using Power Query/M language).
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements, understand business needs, and translate them into effective Power BI solutions.
Be able to communicate with the senior finance team regarding analysis on P&L and Balance Sheet
Ensuring data accuracy and integrity within Power BI reports and underlying data models.
Implementing best practices for data visualisation, user experience, and report performance.
Supporting the preparation of monthly leadership dashboard reporting, covering financial and operational performance.
Supporting the Finance Business Partner regarding Power BI reporting
Contributing to the continuous improvement of data reporting processes and business intelligence initiatives.




Skills & Experience Required

We're looking for candidates with:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst - Power BI or in a similar Business Intelligence role, with a strong portfolio of developed dashboards.
Expert-level proficiency in Power BI Desktop, including extensive experience with Power Query (M), Power Pivot, and advanced DAX.
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data modelling and creating robust, scalable data architectures within Power BI.
Familiarity with financial systems like Oracle and Hyperion is highly desirable.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Strong communication skills to interact effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
A proven ability to identify areas for improvement and drive efficiencies in reporting and data processes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: London (Hybrid)

Company: Albany Beck

Employment type: Permanent




About Albany Beck




Albany Beck is a consultancy firm that partners with some of the most forward-thinking organisations in financial services and beyond. We specialise in delivering high-impact, flexible solutions through a combination of deep industry expertise and dynamic talent. Our culture is built on innovation, collaboration, and integrity values we expect every team member to uphold.




Role Overview:




We are seeking Junior Data / Risk Analysts to join us while we partner with our financial services client‚Äôs First Line Risk Team. This is an exciting opportunity for candidates with some exposure to data or risk, including school leavers, to join a fast-paced environment similar to a trading floor. The successful candidates will work closely with senior stakeholders, analysing trends in market data and providing actionable insights.




Key Responsibilities:




Analyse market and risk data to identify trends and anomalies
Support reporting using Excel and Power BI
Prepare and deliver presentations to senior stakeholders
Proactively raise observations, questions, and ideas to improve processes
Maintain a strong attention to detail while working in a dynamic, high-pressure environment




Candidate Requirements:




Some experience in data analysis, risk, or a related field; school leaver applications considered
Proficiency in Excel; experience with Power BI is a plus
Strong communication and presentation skills
Proactive, confident, and able to voice ideas in a team setting
Excellent attention to detail and ability to pick out trends in complex data
Comfortable interacting with senior stakeholders

Title: Junior Insight Analyst
Description:
THE ALLSAINTS TEAM

At AllSaints we are in the business of feelings - making our customers feel cool and confident. If, like us, you believe in the power of a great outfit, we'd love to talk to you.

We're a global brand made up of a very diverse mix of talented people in a huge variety of roles. Our products are designed in house and made by a small number of suppliers and artisans around the world to sustainable standards.

We are a brand embarking on a very exciting plan and we are seeking new members of the team who want to contribute to this.

THE ROLE:

The Junior Insight Analyst is a crucial member of the AllSaints digital team, reporting to the Global Head of Customer Data and Insight. This role is instrumental in executing the company's customer data and insights strategy, with a primary focus on driving D2C growth across our global markets, including the UK, US, and EU. As part of a focused team, you will support the management and application of customer data to inform key business decisions.

This position requires a solid grasp of customer behavior across both online and offline channels, including our retail stores. The ideal candidate will possess a strong foundational understanding of data modeling and analytics, coupled with excellent communication skills.

WHAT WILL I BE DOING?

Data & Analysis:


Analysis:
Analyse customer behavior across all touchpoints to pinpoint trends, opportunities, and areas for enhancement
Perform customer segmentation to enable targeted marketing campaigns and personalised customer experiences
Assess customer lifetime value and attrition rates to contribute to the development of customer retention and loyalty initiatives
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as website traffic, conversion rates, average transaction values, and customer satisfaction metrics
Reporting:
Take ownership of the timely and accurate delivery of regular reports (weekly, monthly, quarterly, and ad hoc) providing actionable insights at both global and regional levels
Contribute to the design and development of standardised reporting templates and interactive dashboards to effectively track progress and performance against key metrics
Support the presentation of findings and insights to senior management and relevant stakeholders in a clear, concise, and impactful manner
Visualisation:
Utilise data visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) to create visually compelling and informative reports and dashboards
Assist in the development of interactive visualisations that empower users to explore data and extract meaningful insights
Contribute to the design of custom visualisations tailored to specific business needs and requirements
Execution:
Play a supportive role in the execution of the customer data, insights, and analytics strategy, ensuring alignment with e-commerce and D2C objectives
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven initiatives and contribute to the measurement of their impact
Actively seek to expand knowledge of the latest trends and best practices in customer data and analytics
Quality:
Assist in the management of customer data, upholding high standards of data quality, accuracy, and completeness
Support adherence to established data governance policies and procedures to ensure ongoing regulatory compliance (e.g., GDPR, CCPA)


Collaboration & Communication:


Teamwork:
Collaborate effectively and proactively share knowledge with various teams, including digital, retail, merchandising, marketing, IT, and customer service, to support projects and initiatives
Communication:
Clearly and concisely communicate data insights and findings to team members and stakeholders across different levels of the organisation
Assist in translating complex data analysis into actionable insights that are easily understandable for non-technical audiences
Contribute to the preparation and delivery of presentations and reports for senior management and stakeholders


Technical Skills:


SQL:Proficient in writing and optimising SQL queries, with the ability to contribute to data model design
Python: Desirable: familiarity with Python libraries relevant for data analysis (e.g., Pandas, NumPy) and machine learning (e.g., Scikit-learn) is advantageous
Data Visualisation Tools: Experience creating insightful visualisations and dashboards using data visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI)
Web Analytics: Experience tracking and analysing website traffic and user behavior using platforms such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics


WHAT SKILLS DO I NEED?


Experience in a data and insights role, ideally within the retail or fashion sector
Solid SQL skills and practical experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau) and web analytics platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics)
A developing technical understanding of data modeling and analytics principles
Understanding of customer segmentation methodologies and behavior analysis techniques
Strong communication and presentation abilities
Familiarity with CRM systems is beneficial
Awareness of GDPR and data privacy regulations


ABOUT THE LOCATION

Based in our East London Studios in vibrant Shoreditch with perks and benefits offered from local businesses including discounts on food, shopping and health & beauty. Studio Location. Approximately a 10 minute walk from Liverpool Street Station and a 5 minute walk from Shoreditch High Street.

What We Stand For

The Customer is the Boss We work as one proud team to get the best for our customers

One Team We are joined up and encourage others to share their ideas

We Do What We Say We Will We know our goals, and we work with clear outcomes in mind

We Are Responsible We are self aware, understand the impact we have on others and are positive about the future
Show more
HTML:
THE ALLSAINTS TEAM

At AllSaints we are in the business of feelings - making our customers feel cool and confident. If, like us, you believe in the power of a great outfit, we'd love to talk to you.

We're a global brand made up of a very diverse mix of talented people in a huge variety of roles. Our products are designed in house and made by a small number of suppliers and artisans around the world to sustainable standards.

We are a brand embarking on a very exciting plan and we are seeking new members of the team who want to contribute to this.

THE ROLE:

The Junior Insight Analyst is a crucial member of the AllSaints digital team, reporting to the Global Head of Customer Data and Insight. This role is instrumental in executing the company's customer data and insights strategy, with a primary focus on driving D2C growth across our global markets, including the UK, US, and EU. As part of a focused team, you will support the management and application of customer data to inform key business decisions.

This position requires a solid grasp of customer behavior across both online and offline channels, including our retail stores. The ideal candidate will possess a strong foundational understanding of data modeling and analytics, coupled with excellent communication skills.

WHAT WILL I BE DOING?

Data & Analysis:

  • Analysis:
  • Analyse customer behavior across all touchpoints to pinpoint trends, opportunities, and areas for enhancement
  • Perform customer segmentation to enable targeted marketing campaigns and personalised customer experiences
  • Assess customer lifetime value and attrition rates to contribute to the development of customer retention and loyalty initiatives
  • Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as website traffic, conversion rates, average transaction values, and customer satisfaction metrics
  • Reporting:
  • Take ownership of the timely and accurate delivery of regular reports (weekly, monthly, quarterly, and ad hoc) providing actionable insights at both global and regional levels
  • Contribute to the design and development of standardised reporting templates and interactive dashboards to effectively track progress and performance against key metrics
  • Support the presentation of findings and insights to senior management and relevant stakeholders in a clear, concise, and impactful manner
  • Visualisation:
  • Utilise data visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) to create visually compelling and informative reports and dashboards
  • Assist in the development of interactive visualisations that empower users to explore data and extract meaningful insights
  • Contribute to the design of custom visualisations tailored to specific business needs and requirements
  • Execution:
  • Play a supportive role in the execution of the customer data, insights, and analytics strategy, ensuring alignment with e-commerce and D2C objectives
  • Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven initiatives and contribute to the measurement of their impact
  • Actively seek to expand knowledge of the latest trends and best practices in customer data and analytics
  • Quality:
  • Assist in the management of customer data, upholding high standards of data quality, accuracy, and completeness
  • Support adherence to established data governance policies and procedures to ensure ongoing regulatory compliance (e.g., GDPR, CCPA)

Collaboration & Communication:

  • Teamwork:
  • Collaborate effectively and proactively share knowledge with various teams, including digital, retail, merchandising, marketing, IT, and customer service, to support projects and initiatives
  • Communication:
  • Clearly and concisely communicate data insights and findings to team members and stakeholders across different levels of the organisation
  • Assist in translating complex data analysis into actionable insights that are easily understandable for non-technical audiences
  • Contribute to the preparation and delivery of presentations and reports for senior management and stakeholders

Technical Skills:

  • SQL:Proficient in writing and optimising SQL queries, with the ability to contribute to data model design
  • Python: Desirable: familiarity with Python libraries relevant for data analysis (e.g., Pandas, NumPy) and machine learning (e.g., Scikit-learn) is advantageous
  • Data Visualisation Tools: Experience creating insightful visualisations and dashboards using data visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI)
  • Web Analytics: Experience tracking and analysing website traffic and user behavior using platforms such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics

WHAT SKILLS DO I NEED?

  • Experience in a data and insights role, ideally within the retail or fashion sector
  • Solid SQL skills and practical experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau) and web analytics platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics)
  • A developing technical understanding of data modeling and analytics principles
  • Understanding of customer segmentation methodologies and behavior analysis techniques
  • Strong communication and presentation abilities
  • Familiarity with CRM systems is beneficial
  • Awareness of GDPR and data privacy regulations

ABOUT THE LOCATION

Based in our East London Studios in vibrant Shoreditch with perks and benefits offered from local businesses including discounts on food, shopping and health & beauty. Studio Location. Approximately a 10 minute walk from Liverpool Street Station and a 5 minute walk from Shoreditch High Street.

What We Stand For

The Customer is the Boss We work as one proud team to get the best for our customers

One Team We are joined up and encourage others to share their ideas

We Do What We Say We Will We know our goals, and we work with clear outcomes in mind

We Are Responsible We are self aware, understand the impact we have on others and are positive about the future

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics Specialist ‚Äì Banking/Financial Services

Location: Hybrid - Central London

Rate: ¬£450.00 - ¬£500.00 per day inside IR35

Duration: 12 months




About the Role

We are seeking an experienced Analytics Specialist to join our client's growing team and support the execution of their customer engagement strategy through impactful data analytics. This is a hands-on role where you'll collaborate closely with customer engagement teams to uncover actionable insights, enhance campaign effectiveness, and help shape strategic decisions.




Key Responsibilities

Support customer engagement strategy execution through targeted data analytics.
Partner with customer engagement teams to inform and refine campaigns.
Perform customer segmentation and targeting based on performance insights.
Measure and optimise campaign performance using advanced analytics tools.
Develop performance reports and dashboards to track engagement outcomes.
Contribute to the creation of business cases using data-driven insights.
Manage multiple workstreams with attention to detail and deadlines.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to drive coordination and results.




What We‚Äôre Looking For

Minimum 5 years of experience in performance analytics, ideally in a cards or retail banking environment.
Proven experience working alongside customer engagement and marketing teams.
Strong background in campaign measurement, optimisation, and reporting.
Expertise in customer segmentation and targeting based on data insights.
Solid knowledge of data modelling solutions and analytical tools.
Highly organised, detail-oriented, and able to juggle multiple projects.
A collaborative team player who can support senior stakeholders effectively.




Please attach your CV for immediate consideration.
