Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD86582

Position Overview

We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in Canada. This is a hybrid full-time role, reporting to the Sr. Manager of Customer Analytics. As a Business Intelligence Analyst Specialist, your primary responsibility will be to provide valuable insights into user behavior, their product usage patterns, and identifying opportunities for growth. You will help create dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to the stakeholders. Furthermore, you will use your expertise in creating and editing visual content, including maps, charts, and graphs, and transforming data sets into visually compelling visuals. You will also provide visual, technical, and editorial guidance to ensure the highest quality of data visualizations.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with teams to understand business needs and requirements for data analysis
Design and develop data models, dashboards, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders
Create and edit visual content, including maps, charts, and graphs, to provide visual representations of data insights
Transform quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals that effectively communicate important information
Use advanced statistical techniques to analyze and interpret complex datasets
Provide expert-level visual, technical, and editorial guidance to ensure the highest quality of data visualizations
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in data analysis and visualization techniques
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data visualization needs and provide recommendations on the most effective visual representation of data
Conduct quality checks on visual content to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to brand guidelines
Communicate complex data insights through visually compelling presentations and reports, tailored to different audiences


Minimum Requirements


Bachelor's/ Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
5+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role
Expertise in statistical analysis, data modelling, and data visualisation
Proficiency in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or D3.js
Experience working with large datasets and proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
Samples / examples showcasing previous data analysis and visualization projects


Learn More

About Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software ‚Äì from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk ‚Äì it‚Äôs at the core of everything we do. Our culture guides the way we work and treat each other, informs how we connect with customers and partners, and defines how we show up in the world.

When you‚Äôre an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Salary transparency

Salary is one part of Autodesk‚Äôs competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate‚Äôs experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, our compensation package may include annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Sales Careers

Working in sales at Autodesk allows you to build meaningful relationships with customers while growing your career. Join us and help make a better, more sustainable world. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/careers/sales

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Overview

BET99 is Canada's Premiere Online Sportsbook and Casino. Launching in 2020, we have consistently innovated the online gaming landscape every step of the way, exponentially growing our customer base and, in turn, our internal BET99 team!




As a Senior Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be at the forefront of strategic decision-making - turning complex data into insights that drive business success. You bring deep analytical expertise, curiosity to explore complex problems, and a drive to help teams make better decisions. In our fast-paced online sports-book and casino environment, you‚Äôll lead high-impact analytical initiatives, design scalable solutions, and influence how data informs decisions across the business. You‚Äôll also mentor analysts, advocate for data-driven thinking, and contribute to a culture of excellence grounded in challenging the status quo, trust, transparency, integrity, and collaboration.




Responsibilities:

Partner with stakeholders to gather requirements, define analytical goals, and translate business questions into data solutions.
Apply advanced statistical methods and exploratory analysis to guide strategic decisions in product, marketing, and player engagement
Use Python (and PySpark where appropriate) to clean, transform, and analyze large, complex datasets.
Design and scale dashboards and reporting frameworks in Power BI to support business visibility and planning.
Lead analyses of player behaviour and marketing campaign performance, including segmentation, lifecycle modelling, and retention optimization.
Write and optimize complex SQL queries to extract and structure data from various sources.
Communicate findings clearly through strategic recommendations tailored for senior stakeholders.
Define and track core business metrics; design and evaluate A/B tests and experiments.
Mentor junior analysts, contribute to technical development, and uphold quality through code reviews.
Drive automation and scalable reporting solutions to improve efficiency and reliability.
Ensure outputs are accurate, validated, reproducible, and actionable.




Skills and Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in online gaming, sports-book, or digital consumer sectors.
Hands-on experience with marketing analytics, including campaign performance analysis, customer segmentation, and lifecycle insights.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science).
Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques including A/B testing, experimental design, and predictive modelling.
Expertise in SQL and Python; PySpark experience preferred.
Proven experience designing and building effective dashboards in Power BI or equivalent tools.
Familiarity with modern cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks).
Strong project ownership and ability to manage multiple complex initiatives.
Experience mentoring team members or leading technical efforts.

HTML:
Job Overview

BET99 is Canada's Premiere Online Sportsbook and Casino. Launching in 2020, we have consistently innovated the online gaming landscape every step of the way, exponentially growing our customer base and, in turn, our internal BET99 team!


As a Senior Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be at the forefront of strategic decision-making - turning complex data into insights that drive business success. You bring deep analytical expertise, curiosity to explore complex problems, and a drive to help teams make better decisions. In our fast-paced online sports-book and casino environment, you‚Äôll lead high-impact analytical initiatives, design scalable solutions, and influence how data informs decisions across the business. You‚Äôll also mentor analysts, advocate for data-driven thinking, and contribute to a culture of excellence grounded in challenging the status quo, trust, transparency, integrity, and collaboration.


Responsibilities:

  • Partner with stakeholders to gather requirements, define analytical goals, and translate business questions into data solutions.
  • Apply advanced statistical methods and exploratory analysis to guide strategic decisions in product, marketing, and player engagement
  • Use Python (and PySpark where appropriate) to clean, transform, and analyze large, complex datasets.
  • Design and scale dashboards and reporting frameworks in Power BI to support business visibility and planning.
  • Lead analyses of player behaviour and marketing campaign performance, including segmentation, lifecycle modelling, and retention optimization.
  • Write and optimize complex SQL queries to extract and structure data from various sources.
  • Communicate findings clearly through strategic recommendations tailored for senior stakeholders.
  • Define and track core business metrics; design and evaluate A/B tests and experiments.
  • Mentor junior analysts, contribute to technical development, and uphold quality through code reviews.
  • Drive automation and scalable reporting solutions to improve efficiency and reliability.
  • Ensure outputs are accurate, validated, reproducible, and actionable.


Skills and Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in online gaming, sports-book, or digital consumer sectors.
  • Hands-on experience with marketing analytics, including campaign performance analysis, customer segmentation, and lifecycle insights.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science).
  • Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques including A/B testing, experimental design, and predictive modelling.
  • Expertise in SQL and Python; PySpark experience preferred.
  • Proven experience designing and building effective dashboards in Power BI or equivalent tools.
  • Familiarity with modern cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks).
  • Strong project ownership and ability to manage multiple complex initiatives.
  • Experience mentoring team members or leading technical efforts.
  • Exceptional communication and storytelling skills, especially for non-technical audiences.
  • High standards of accuracy, integrity, and continuous improvement.

Title: Data Analyst - Marketing - Toronto, Canada
Description:
Who We Are

Born from a mission to make prescription eyewear affordable and accessible to everyone, Zenni Optical has been changing the way people see the world since 2003. With complete prescription pairs for adults and kids starting at under $10, we‚Äôve grown into a global brand with over 51 million pairs of glasses sold ‚Äî and counting!

Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, we're proud to be the Official Eyewear of the San Francisco 49ers, Boston Celtics, Monster Jam, Ghost Gaming, TSM, Major League Pickleball and more. We've also partnered with tastemakers and designers like Chase Stokes, Jrue Holiday, and George and Claire Kittle to bring our brand to life in bold, meaningful ways.

Innovation is at the heart of everything we do at Zenni ‚Äî from our revolutionary EyeQLenz‚Ñ¢ with Zenni ID Guard‚Ñ¢ glasses to our cutting-edge VR Vision Screener, we're constantly exploring new ways to improve vision and enhance lives. For more information, please visit zenni.com/press.

Candidate safety is important to us. Please note that all official communication will only be sent from @zennioptical.com addresses.

About the Role:

To support our rapid growth, we are currently looking for a strong tech background data analyst to be part of the Data Engineering team that builds analytics systems to enable a data-driven company. This position will be a valuable member of our team and is expected to open data visibility to the whole organization, provide key metrics to all levels of leadership and build data models for business decision optimization. You will work across key business domains including e-commerce funnel analysis, Marketing, CRM, Inventory, Supply Chain, and Customer Service, leveraging enriched data to drive meaningful impact across the organization.

Position Overview:

To support our rapid growth, we are currently looking for a strong tech background data analyst to be part of the Data Engineering team that builds analytics systems to enable a data-driven company. This position will be a valuable member of our team and is expected to open data visibility to the whole organization, provide key metrics to all levels of leadership and build data models for business decision optimization. You will work across key business domains including e-commerce funnel analysis, Marketing, CRM, Inventory, Supply Chain, and Customer Service, leveraging enriched data to drive meaningful impact across the organization

Predictors for Success:

You have a strong understanding of how data engineering and analytics teams operate, and you thrive in a fast-paced environment with multiple concurrent initiatives. You bring experience working with large cross-functional teams and are committed to leading tasks and projects end-to-end.

Responsibilities:


Develop, optimize, and maintain analytics systems and data models to support data-driven decision-making across the organization
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across North America and China, including product, engineering, marketing, merchandising, finance, CRM, UX, customer support, and leadership
Conduct in-depth analysis across key business domains, including e-commerce funnel, marketing performance, CRM metrics, inventory trends, supply chain efficiency, and customer service effectiveness
Build visibility into organizational data and deliver actionable insights through dashboards, KPIs, and reporting tools
Lead end-to-end analytics projects, including scoping, requirements gathering, implementation, QA, and stakeholder communication
Translate complex data findings into clear, compelling narratives for both technical and non-technical audiences
Drive meaningful business impact through the use of enriched data, modern analytics tools, and performance storytelling
Contribute to fostering a data-first culture within the company by providing strategic recommendations and business optimization insights


Basic Qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related technical field
Minimum 3 years of experience in data analytics, specifically Marketing domain
Strong background in marketing analytics with a minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience
At least 2 years of hands-on experience in e-commerce analytics
Expert-level proficiency in SQL
Proficient in Python and dbt
High proficiency in data visualization tools such as Looker or Tableau
Experience with raw event data platforms such as RudderStack or Google Analytics
Strong experience in data modeling
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Demonstrated ability to manage and deliver projects independently in a fast-paced environment


Preferred Qualifications:


Strong background in data engineering and familiarity with modern data stack architecture
Experience working on global or cross-regional teams (e.g., North America and China collaboration)
Demonstrated ability to drive significant business outcomes through data initiatives
Passion for data storytelling and strategic thinking
Proven adaptability and success in high-velocity team environments
Experience inspiring teams to think big and deliver scalable data solutions


Benefits:


Annual Bonus Program
Healthcare: 100% premiums covered for extended medical, dental, and vision premiums paid by the company for employees (50% for dependents)
Group & dependent life, AD&D, and long term disability coverage
Company-matched RRSP contributions up to 4%
Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for mental health and wellness support
Free access for you and your family to our digital wellness platform - Wellness Coach
Generous PTO in addition to our Week of Zen - the time between Christmas and New Year‚Äôs to relax and recuperate
Fully Paid Parental Leave - 16 weeks for birthing and non-birthing parents
Family forming and fertility support & services through Maven
Annual Zenni Gift Card - to use towards our products!


Compensation

In addition to other forms of compensation like perks and benefits, the estimated range for this role is CAD $95,000 - 105,000. The final offer will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skill set, experience, geographical location, market conditions, and other organizational needs. The Company reserves the right to change, modify, or revisit the salary range for various reasons including business needs.

We look forward to hearing from you!

We strive to build a diverse team of individuals with a broad range of experience and perspectives. We encourage you to apply even if you don‚Äôt feel you meet all the qualifications.

Zenni Optical is an equal opportunity workplace and considers applications without regard to race, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital
Description:
GENERAL FUNCTION

Momentum's Analytics team is looking for a Data Analyst ‚Äì Digital to join our growing Analytics Team. This individual will be the key person for consulting with the business to share data insights providing solutions, reports and strategies to grow our Digital market and associated products. Reporting directly to the Senior Manager of Analytics, the Data Analyst ‚Äì Digital will be the data subject matter expert for all Digital platforms and products, working closely with the product and marketing department. In addition to sharing data insights, the individual will have opportunities to work closely with business leaders in presenting findings and formulating data supported strategies.

If you see analytics as an opportunity to solve problems, build relationships, drive business and have fun while doing it, you've come to the right place.

DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES


Leverage data expertise to analyze a wide spectrum of data to provide insights and solutions to the business.
Identify and improve inefficiencies or issues in current data processes and reports with a "there's always room for improvement" mindset.
Conceive, design & develop purpose focused reports and dashboards that drives value and meets business needs
Manipulate large data sets from multiple sources to provide business metric reporting
Communicate concise and actionable business strategies from vast amounts of data for Sr. Management.


EDUCATION


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Decision Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Engineering, Finance, or Economics


EXPERIENCE


Experience or knowledge of reporting, analysis and strategy development in the financial services industry, with a strong passion to learn and improve.
Experience or knowledge of digital market trends and strategies, such as running digital-only marketing campaigns, launching digital specific products, capturing and analyzing data from digital platforms.
Experience using Google Analytics, GA4 and Big Query
Proven experience using SQL, R, Python, or similar data mining and analytics applications.
Experience with Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft SSRS or other tools.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Capable of completing descriptive, diagnostic, exploratory, predictive, and prescriptive analytical exercises.
Proven ability to effectively analyze and interpret large amounts of raw data to accurately convey business needs.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, and ability to simply explain complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong work ethic, curious and persistent determination in reviewing and reconciling variances.
Ability to work autonomously as well as in a team setting.
Aptitude and willingness to roll-up the sleeves and get involved in the details.
Highly curious with the desire to go deep beneath the surface to solve problems.
Good business judgment with demonstrated ability to think creatively and strategically.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ameresco, Inc. (NYSE:AMRC) is a leading energy solutions provider dedicated to helping customers reduce costs, enhance resilience, and decarbonize to net zero in the global energy transition. We are a trusted, full-service partner to public sector and government entities, K-12 schools, higher education, utilities, and healthcare customers across the U.S., Canada, the U.K., and Europe.

At Ameresco, we show the way by developing, constructing and operating tailored smart energy efficiency solutions, distributed energy resources, and infrastructure upgrades that drive cost savings, resilience, decarbonization, and innovation. Our comprehensive portfolio is built to address the challenges of today and adapt the future, ensuring long-term sustainability and success for our customers.

Ameresco has an immediate opening for a Data Analyst. The position is a 12 Month Contract position. This position will support the implementation and delivery of the AssetPlanner¬Æ software suite. This role involves data entry, analysis, software configuration, client support, and training. The successful candidate will work closely with internal teams and clients to ensure high-quality data and effective software use.

Responsibilities:


Enter and analyze data related to building structures and systems.
Respond to client requests for data updates, support, and configuration changes.
Provide client support via the support line, service request database, and perform annual client check-ins as required.
Conduct phone interviews with clients to gather information on capital assets and input data into the AssetPlanner¬Æ software.
Perform quality assurance reviews of building condition assessment data to ensure alignment with established standards.
Review and input existing client data and documentation.
Assist in developing client-facing reports and presentations.
Support software implementation, including database configuration, client onboarding, and training sessions.
Participate in software testing, provide enhancement suggestions, and report bugs.
Provide support for the Energy and Maintenance modules as needed.


Minimum Qualifications:


University degree.


Additional Qualifications:


Engineering degree/certification a plus.
Experience working with data in an analyst role.
Background in facilities management, building science, or engineering is an asset.
Experience in client or customer service roles.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and MS Office products.
Experience with asset management software is an asset.
Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new software applications.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Professional, courteous, and client-focused demeanor.


Ameresco Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodations for applicants with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION




Insight Global is seeking a Sr. Data Analyst for one of Canada's top insurance companies. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will contribute by working on complex data analysis projects while also supporting your team through coaching on the use of data analytics. You will demonstrate critical judgment in determining how a business objective can be addressed and decompose complex problems or high-level business objectives into smaller problems that can be solved using data analytics.







REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE




- 5+ years experience in BI or a related field

- Strong understanding of data analysis, programming/tools, data warehouse/data management, and data modeling

- Experience in end-to-end production implementation process for analytical solutions

- Power BI or MicroStrategy

- Excellent communication skills







NICE TO HAVE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE




- Microsoft Power Platform or PowerApps

- Insurance experience

√Ä propos du poste:

Vous transformerez des ensembles de donn√©es complexes en informations claires et exploitables, qui orienteront la strat√©gie de marque, la planification et la performance dans plusieurs domaines th√©rapeutiques. De l‚Äôestimation du march√© et de l‚Äôanalyse concurrentielle √† la mod√©lisation des incitatifs sur le terrain et √† la planification des marques, vous faciliterez des d√©cisions bas√©es sur les donn√©es tout en aidant l‚Äôorganisation √† progresser vers des analyses pr√©dictives et prescriptives.

Vous analyserez les √©tats pathologiques, les environnements concurrentiels, les conditions du march√©, les tendances de croissance et les parts de march√© afin de produire des insights strat√©giques qui orientent la direction commerciale tout au long du cycle de vie du produit, de la pr√©paration au lancement jusqu‚Äô√† la fin de vie.
Vous construirez et interpr√©terez des tableaux de bord de performance et de suivi, actualiserez les mod√®les mensuels et faciliterez les rapports nationaux et sous-nationaux pour soutenir la prise de d√©cision en temps opportun par les √©quipes de marque et de direction.

Vous effectuerez des analyses approfondies du march√© et de la conversion des patients, formulerez des hypoth√®ses et prioriserez les innovations commerciales qui produisent un impact mesurable.
Vous favoriserez la culture de la donn√©e de marque en clarifiant les flux de donn√©es et leurs limites, en am√©liorant les questions bas√©es sur les donn√©es et en int√©grant les insights dans la prise de d√©cision quotidienne.
Vous stimulerez l‚Äôexcellence des √©quipes sur le terrain en proposant et en optimisant les protocoles d‚Äôincitation, en surveillant l‚Äôatteinte des quotas et en recalibrant les quotas territoriaux au besoin pour maintenir la performance.
Vous g√©rerez les aspects administratifs des op√©rations de recherche, notamment en √©valuant et en n√©gociant avec les fournisseurs de recherche de march√© et en veillant √† ce que les contrats et la documentation soient complets et √† jour.

Ce que vous apportez:

Vous d√©montrez un solide jugement analytique, des comp√©tences en interpr√©tation des donn√©es et en soutien √† la prise de d√©cision, avec la capacit√© de travailler de mani√®re autonome et de g√©rer plusieurs projets dans des environnements dynamiques.

Adecco is hiring on behalf of our client for a Market Analytics & Business Intelligence (MABI) Analyst to join a high-impact commercial analytics team in the pharmaceutical sector. This hybrid role is based at the Canada Head Office in Saint-Laurent, Qu√©bec, with a schedule of three days onsite and two days offsite. This is a 6-month contract, working 7.25 hours per day (36.25 hours per week).




About the role

You will transform complex datasets into clear, actionable insights that guide brand strategy, planning, and performance across multiple therapeutic areas. From market sizing and competitor analysis to field incentive modeling and brand planning, you‚Äôll enable data-driven decisions while helping the organization advance toward predictive and prescriptive analytics.

What you‚Äôll do

You will develop annual market research brand plans grounded in a deep understanding of brand strategy, customer dynamics, and affiliate priorities, ensuring decisions are informed by robust qualitative and quantitative evidence.
You will analyze disease states, competitor landscapes, market environments, growth trends, and market share to produce strategic insights that shape commercial direction across the product lifecycle, from launch readiness through end-of-life.
You will build and interpret performance dashboards and tracking, refresh monthly models, and facilitate national and sub-national reporting that supports timely decision-making by brand and leadership teams.
You will elevate customer planning by enabling segmentation and targeting, translating complex analyses into clear narratives for commercial stakeholders and senior management.
You will conduct in-depth market and patient conversion analyses, formulate hypotheses, and prioritize business innovations that deliver measurable impact.
You will champion brand data literacy by clarifying data workflows and limitations, improving data-driven questions, and embedding insights in daily decision-making.
You will drive in-field team excellence by proposing and optimizing incentive protocols, monitoring quota attainment, and recalibrating territory quotas as needed to sustain performance.
You will manage administrative elements of research operations, including assessing and negotiating with market research suppliers and ensuring contracts and documentation are complete and current.

What you bring

You have 3+ years of relevant experience in data analysis, ideally within the pharmaceutical industry, with a track record of turning complex data into strategic, business-ready insights.
You demonstrate strong analytical judgment, data interpretation, and decision support capabilities, with the ability to operate independently and manage multiple projects in dynamic environments.
You are adept at data storytelling and integration, handling large datasets with precision and translating findings for non-technical audiences, including senior stakeholders.
You show meticulous attention to detail and can fluidly switch between strategic and tactical thinking to meet evolving business needs.
You have excellent interpersonal skills and thrive in cross-functional settings, building relationships, facilitating discussions, and influencing through insight.
You hold a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business or science; an advanced degree (Master‚Äôs or PhD) is an asset.
You have familiarity with Javelin software, which is considered a plus, and you are comfortable navigating analytics and reporting environments.

Work arrangement and contract

Location: Saint-Laurent, Qu√©bec (Canada Head Office).
Schedule: Hybrid ‚Äî three days onsite, two days offsite.
Term: 6-month assignment, extension potential.
Hours: 7.25 hours per day (36.25 hours per week).

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Inclusion without Exception




Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer, and embraces diversity in race, nationality, ethnicity, gender, age, physical ability, neurodiversity, and sexual orientation, to create a workforce that reflects the societies we operate in. Our continued commitment to Culture and Diversity is reflected in our people‚Äôs stories across our workforce and implemented through equitable workplace policies and processes.




TCS is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world‚Äôs largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive-powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile‚Ñ¢ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS operates in 55 countries and employs over 607,000 highly skilled individuals, including more than 10,000 in Canada. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $30 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2025, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Job Description:

Must Have Technical/Functional Skills

‚Ä¢ 5+years with Data Analyst experience andshould be able to collect, Process and analyze large financial datasets

‚Ä¢ Interpret data trends and patterns toprovide actionable insights

‚Ä¢ Proficient/advanced SQL skills with the ability to write and optimize queries.

‚Ä¢ Capital markets /banking domain exp, Knowledge in banking products, payment domain, regulatory reporting, data analytics

‚Ä¢ Expertise in data analysis and ability to interpret financial datasets.

‚Ä¢ Experience in business analysis, requirement gathering, and process optimization.

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Excel, BI tools, or other data visualization platforms is a plus.

‚Ä¢ 10+ years‚Äô experience with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), core data management, data quality and governance experience.

‚Ä¢ 6 + years of experience in Financial Services required

‚Ä¢ Demonstrate leadership in managing large and complex regulatory and data transformation programs

‚Ä¢ Understanding of products including Banking, Global Markets, Loans, Commercial Banking and Services.

‚Ä¢ 5+ years defining use cases to articulate new functional software needs and the roles of each class of application usage.

‚Ä¢ 2+ years‚Äô experience with SharePoint, JIRA, and Confluence

‚Ä¢ 3+ years‚Äô experience working with SQL, data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI for reporting and metrics.

‚Ä¢ Very strong written and oral executive communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Utilize in-depth knowledge of concepts and procedures given the scale of systems and data landscape including data acquisition, CDO and technical teams, the ideal person will have very good mix of functional and technical skills to implement solution for data provisioning, data governance and data consumption for all regulatory and management reports.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with stakeholders/partners to take forward data strategies and be engaged with them continuously to support new data demand onboarding to the Data fabric.

‚Ä¢ Becomes a resident expert in the Technology Data plan and the target state architecture to enable the ability to drive execution progress and remove obstacles with authority

‚Ä¢ Provides IT strategic direction for projects managed including developing detailed IT work plans, schedules, project estimates, resource plans, tracking of plans, risks/issues/dependencies and providing status reports.

‚Ä¢ Provide technical expertise and/or partner with technology leads to ensure the efficient design, development and implementation and to ensure essential procedures are followed in data space

‚Ä¢ Resolve issues that have impact beyond own area and apply in-depth understanding of business analysis concepts and procedures and basic knowledge of other areas

‚Ä¢ Utilize in-depth knowledge of concepts and procedures within data warehouse / data lake management and other related areas to understand interfaces and resolve issues.

‚Ä¢ Validate detailed requirements, working through solutions and managing execution and rollout of these solutions. Responsible for the application meeting project specifications and client‚Äôs expectations

‚Ä¢ Integrate in-depth knowledge of applications development with overall technology function to achieve established goals.

‚Ä¢ Influence and negotiate with senior leaders across functions, as well as communicate with external parties, as necessary.

‚Ä¢ Work as a team to achieve objectives and influence and negotiate with senior leaders across functions, communicating with external parties as needed

‚Ä¢ Ability to run meetings and workshops to drive data solutions with groups of senior stakeholders in concise and efficient manner.

‚Ä¢ Act as an anchor point for all the business and data solutions, ensuring alignment to the business vision




Roles & Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Utilize in-depth knowledge of concepts and procedures given the scale of Citi‚Äôs system and data landscape including data acquisition, CDO and technical teams, the ideal person will have very good mix of functional and technical skills to implement solution for data provisioning, data governance and data consumption for all regulatory and management reports.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with stakeholders/partners to take forward data strategies and be engaged with them continuously to support new data demand onboarding to the Data fabric.

‚Ä¢ SQL & Data Analysis

¬∑ Write and optimize SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data from multiple sources.

¬∑ Perform data validation, cleansing, and reconciliation to ensure accuracy.

¬∑ Generate reports and dashboards for business insights.

‚Ä¢Capital Markets & Financial Knowledge:

¬∑ Apply Capital markets /banking domain knowledge to analyze trading and market data.

¬∑ Work with stakeholders to understand financial products, risk exposure, and trade lifecycle processes

¬∑ Collaborate with teams to optimize trade data and reporting systems.

¬∑ Reconcile financial data and support accounting teams in maintaining data integrity.

¬∑ Assist in financial reporting, audits, and regulatory compliance.

‚Ä¢Business Analysis:

¬∑ Gather and document business requirements for data-driven initiatives.

¬∑ Work with cross-functional teams to improve data workflows and reporting frameworks.

¬∑ Support business stakeholders in decision-making through data insights.

¬∑ Identify inefficiencies and propose solutions to enhance operational effectiveness.




‚Ä¢Utilize in-depth knowledge of concepts and procedures within data warehouse / data lake management and other related areas to understand interfaces and resolve issues.

‚Ä¢ Validate detailed requirements, working through solutions and managing execution and rollout of these solutions. Responsible for the application meeting project specifications and client‚Äôs expectations

‚Ä¢ Integrate in-depth knowledge of applications development with overall technology function to achieve established goals.

‚Ä¢ Influence and negotiate with senior leaders across functions, as well as communicate with external parties, as necessary.

‚Ä¢ Work as a team to achieve objectives and influence and negotiate with senior leaders across functions, communicating with external parties as needed

‚Ä¢ Ability to run meetings and workshops to drive data solutions with groups of senior stakeholders in concise and efficient manner.

‚Ä¢ Act as an anchor point for all the business and data solutions, ensuring alignment to the business vision




Tata Consultancy Services Canada Inc. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resources.







Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualifications for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

Title: Analyst, Data & Process Improvement
Description:
Come make your difference in communities across Canada, where authenticity, trust and making connections is valued ‚Äì as we shape the future of Canadian retail, together. Our unique position as one of the country's largest employers, coupled with our commitment to positively impact the lives of all Canadians, provides our colleagues a range of opportunities and experiences to help Canadians Live Life Well¬Æ.

At Loblaw Companies Limited, we succeed through collaboration and commitment and set a high bar for ourselves and those around us. Whether you are just starting your career, re-entering the workforce, or looking for a new job, this is where you belong.

Job Summary

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our Strategic Planning and Project Management team. You will play an integral role in our data and systems setup process, engaging with business partners and participating in projects and initiatives. This position implements processes and governance to ensure data integrity and data standards in our reporting tool as well as builds and leverages automation and artificial intelligence (AI) tools to drive efficiencies in day-to-day LRE tasks.

Responsibilities


Act as a conduit between Loblaw Real Estate (LRE) departments, Loblaw Technology and Analytics (LTA) & LRE Leadership team to clarify and translate business and or operational requirements into technical documentation and conceptual report designs
Recommend and facilitate development of reports and application features (regular & ad-hoc)
Develop, run, validate and review reports, analyze trends, monitor and maximize operational excellence, and summarize analyses for report end users
Deliver said analysis & reports in the most effective way possible for the audience through PowerPoint and dashboards
Create, modify, and enhance new and on-going data reports and scorecards
Identify opportunities and tools for automation and building dashboards in PowerBI
Maintain business requirements, functional requirements and technical specification documentation for application and reports
Assess impact to application and reports due to process changes and improvements
Participate in Request for Proposal processes related to LRE workflows
Document current and future state data, systems, and process workflows
Contribute to ideas and actions towards continuous improvement of business processes, data quality and reporting within LRE
Assist with data related technical challenges and perform root cause analysis for Power Platform reporting tool (the Source)
Data steward for ensuring consistency and accuracy of data in LRE communication tool
Ability to build and create new process to create efficiencies in the way we work
Participate in day-to-day data entry and cleansing activities
Leverage AI tools to automate, optimize and increase the accuracy of data across LRE functions


Qualifications


Post-Secondary education in Business or related field, or equivalent related experience
Exceptional computer skills (MS Excel and quantitative and statistical analysis tools), including experience with Power Platform
Strong knowledge and understanding of relational databases and querying ability using Advanced Excel, DAX, VBA Macro, SQL is a key skill
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail
Enjoys working in an environment of fast paced change and ambiguity
Well developed analytical and problem-solving skills
An extraordinary teammate with strong detail orientation is important
Must be able to manage time effectively through flexibility and prioritization
A proactive and self-motivated attitude, with a willingness to take initiative and learn new skills


Note


This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the position and does not encompass all tasks or responsibilities that may be required. The successful candidate may be assigned additional duties as necessary to meet the needs of the organization.
We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and experiences.


Our commitment to Sustainability and Social Impact is an essential part of the way we do business, and we focus our attention on areas where we can have the greatest impact. Our approach to sustainability and social impact is based on three pillars ‚Äì Environment, Sourcing and Community ‚Äì and we are constantly looking for ways to demonstrate leadership in these important areas. Our CORE Values ‚Äì Care, Ownership, Respect and Excellence ‚Äì guide all our decision-making and come to life through our Blue Culture. We offer our colleagues progressive careers, comprehensive training, flexibility, and other competitive benefits ‚Äì these are some of the many reasons why we are one of Canada‚Äôs Top Employers, Canada‚Äôs Best Diversity Employers, Canada‚Äôs Greenest Employers & Canada‚Äôs Top Employers for Young People.

If you are unsure whether your experience matches every requirement above, we encourage you to apply anyway. We are looking for varied perspectives which include diverse experiences that we can add to our team.

We have a long-standing focus on diversity, equity and inclusion because we know it will make our company a better place to work and shop. We are committed to creating accessible environments for our colleagues, candidates and customers. Requests for accommodation due to a disability (which may be visible or invisible, temporary or permanent) can be made at any stage of application and employment. We encourage candidates to make their accommodation needs known so that we can provide equitable opportunities.

Please Note:

Candidates who are 18 years or older are required to complete a criminal background check. Details will be provided through the application process.

Come make your difference in communities across Canada, where authenticity, trust and making connections is valued ‚Äì as we shape the future of Canadian retail, together. Our unique position as one of the country's largest employers, coupled with our commitment to positively impact the lives of all Canadians, provides our colleagues a range of opportunities and experiences to help Canadians Live Life Well¬Æ.

At Loblaw Companies Limited, we succeed through collaboration and commitment and set a high bar for ourselves and those around us. Whether you are just starting your career, re-entering the workforce, or looking for a new job, this is where you belong.

Job Summary

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our Strategic Planning and Project Management team. You will play an integral role in our data and systems setup process, engaging with business partners and participating in projects and initiatives. This position implements processes and governance to ensure data integrity and data standards in our reporting tool as well as builds and leverages automation and artificial intelligence (AI) tools to drive efficiencies in day-to-day LRE tasks.

Responsibilities

  • Act as a conduit between Loblaw Real Estate (LRE) departments, Loblaw Technology and Analytics (LTA) & LRE Leadership team to clarify and translate business and or operational requirements into technical documentation and conceptual report designs
  • Recommend and facilitate development of reports and application features (regular & ad-hoc)
  • Develop, run, validate and review reports, analyze trends, monitor and maximize operational excellence, and summarize analyses for report end users
  • Deliver said analysis & reports in the most effective way possible for the audience through PowerPoint and dashboards
  • Create, modify, and enhance new and on-going data reports and scorecards
  • Identify opportunities and tools for automation and building dashboards in PowerBI
  • Maintain business requirements, functional requirements and technical specification documentation for application and reports
  • Assess impact to application and reports due to process changes and improvements
  • Participate in Request for Proposal processes related to LRE workflows
  • Document current and future state data, systems, and process workflows
  • Contribute to ideas and actions towards continuous improvement of business processes, data quality and reporting within LRE
  • Assist with data related technical challenges and perform root cause analysis for Power Platform reporting tool (the Source)
  • Data steward for ensuring consistency and accuracy of data in LRE communication tool
  • Ability to build and create new process to create efficiencies in the way we work
  • Participate in day-to-day data entry and cleansing activities
  • Leverage AI tools to automate, optimize and increase the accuracy of data across LRE functions

Qualifications

  • Post-Secondary education in Business or related field, or equivalent related experience
  • Exceptional computer skills (MS Excel and quantitative and statistical analysis tools), including experience with Power Platform
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of relational databases and querying ability using Advanced Excel, DAX, VBA Macro, SQL is a key skill
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail
  • Enjoys working in an environment of fast paced change and ambiguity
  • Well developed analytical and problem-solving skills
  • An extraordinary teammate with strong detail orientation is important
  • Must be able to manage time effectively through flexibility and prioritization
  • A proactive and self-motivated attitude, with a willingness to take initiative and learn new skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Ottawa, Canada

In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.

For decades, Ottawa has been a global technology leader. Today, Canada‚Äôs capital holds one of the brightest and most diverse technological ecosystems in North America. Voted as Canada‚Äôs best place to live 2017 by Maclean's, Ottawa offers a low cost of living with a high quality of life. The Thales Ottawa office has been a major supplier and long-term trusted partner to DND, enabling the Canadian Armed Forces and the Canadian Coast Guard to achieve mission success.

This position is Hybrid Ottawa

Data Analyst

Position Summary

As a Data Analyst working within the Data Governance team, your main role will focus on documenting data assets, identifying data owners and stewards, and ensuring that data governance processes are structured and consistent across the organization. You will play a key role in facilitating data governance by ensuring that data is clearly defined, accessible, and properly managed according to organizational policies and compliance requirements.

Key Areas of Responsibility


Document Data Assets, including data definitions and data sources. Creating and maintaining the data inventory.
Collaborate with business units to identify data owners and data stewards to ensure the accuracy, security and usage of specific datasets within the enterprise.
Ensure data governance processes maintain the integrity of data with the governance framework.
Monitor data trends, analyze data quality and recommend actions to improve the integrity and consistency of the data across the organization.
Work closely with business stakeholders, technical teams, and the Data Governance team members to ensure alignment between data governance needs and business requirements.
Facilitate meetings and workshops to gather document requirements of data management and governance.
Assist in the development and continuous improvement of data governance policies, procedures and tools that ensure data security, compliance and accessibility.
Maintain and report the status of data ownership and stewardship of various datasets.



Minimum Requirements


3 years of related experience in data analysis, data governance, or a similar role.
University degree in statics, mathematics, computer science, data science, Business administration or a related field.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office tools



Preferred Qualifications


Experience in documenting Data assets, defining data flows, and creating data dictionaries or glossaries.



Special Position Requirements


Schedule: 40 hours per week. Hybrid position ‚Äì a mix of working from home.
Travel: Occasional domestic.



What We Offer


Thales provides an extensive benefits program for all full-time employees working 24 or more hours per week and their eligible dependents, including the following:
Company paid Extended Health, Dental, HSA, Life, AD&D, Short-term Disability, Cancer Care Program, travel insurance, Employee Assistance Plan and Well-Being program.
Retirement Savings Plans (RRSP, DCPP, TFSA) with a company contribution and a match to a DCPP, with no vesting period.
Company paid holidays, vacation days, and paid sick leave.
Voluntary Life, AD&D, Critical Illness, Long-Term Disability.
Employee Discounts on home, auto, and gym membership.



Why Join Us?

Say HI and learn more about working at Thales click here.

(https://youtu.be/9aMF4NMhEJo)

#hybrid

The reference Total Target Compensation(TTC) market range for this position, inclusive of annual base salary and the variable compensation target, is between

Total Target Cash (TTC): 66,568.75 - 89,888.55 - 114,626.95 CAD Annual

This reflects how companies in a similar industry and geographic region generally pay for similar jobs. This range helps the Company make pay decisions as one data point among many. Where a position falls within this range is also dependent on other factors including ‚Äì but not limited to ‚Äì the employee‚Äôs career path history, competencies, skills, and performance, as well as the company‚Äôs annual salary budget, the customer‚Äôs program requirements, and the company‚Äôs internal equity. Thales may offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant‚Äôs status protected by local, state, or federal law.

(For Internal candidate, if you need more information, please reach out to your HR Shared service, 1st Point)

Retirement Savings Plans (RRSP, DCPP, TFSA) with a company contribution and a match to a DCPP, with no vesting period.
Company paid holidays, vacation days, and paid sick leave.
Voluntary Life, AD&D, Critical Illness, Long-Term Disability.
Employee Discounts on home, auto, and gym membership.



Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Title: Data Analyst, Product
Description:
THE TEAM

The mission of the Data & Analytics Department is to provide the business with actionable and accurate information to enable data-driven decision-making.




THE OPPORTUNITY

As the Data Analyst, you will combine your deep understanding of who our clients are, with your passion for data and masterful analytics skills to uncover opportunities that will enable Aritzia to create long lasting relationships with clients. And, with the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless ‚Äì from a rewarding career in Data & Analytics to continued growth and development with Aritzia.




THE ROLE

As the Data Analyst, Data & Analytics, you will:

Partner and innovate with business leaders to deeply understand or identify the strategic opportunities across client acquisition, activation, retention and reactivation
Define measurement strategies to quantify the performance of various customer programs and compare their current condition against a hindsight benchmark
Support with generating actionable insights by analyzing customer behaviour through diagnostics, correlations, and hypothesis testing to grow the business and enhance customer experience
Clearly and accurately visualize and communicate data and analytics through reports, dashboards, and presentations to maximize strategic decisions




THE QUALIFICATIONS

The Data Analyst, Data & Analytics, has:

Proven skills, education, and/or applicable certifications in:
SQL
Visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI)
Python
R or related statistical analysis tools
A commitment to learn and apply Aritzia's Values and Business and People Leadership principles
The ability to collaborate fluently with cross-functional partners.
A commitment to quality and investing in results that add value to the business
An enthusiastic approach to taking on new opportunities and challenges
A commitment to navigating our internal operations to achieve the best team and business results
The skills to set clear objectives with an emphasis on accountability while striving to reach your highest potential
A sense of urgency and ability to prioritize important work
An understanding and a passion for the industry in which we operate




THE COMPENSATION

The typical hiring range for this position is $75,000 - $125,000 CAD per year. The final agreed upon salary may vary based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills and experience.




We are always looking for top talent. If your qualifications differ from those listed above, the scope of work and final agreed upon salary may be adjusted to reflect your individual qualifications.




Aritzia‚Äôs Everyday Luxury compensation package goes beyond the base salary with endless growth and recognition opportunities through our pay-for-performance philosophy. With comprehensive benefits, aspirational workspaces and elevated employee perks and experiences ‚Äî we provide it all.




THE PERKS

Product Discount ‚Äî Maybe you‚Äôve heard of our famous product discount? Or our exclusive private shopping events? You have now.
A-OK Commissary & Cafe ‚Äî Everyday Luxury dining, exclusive to Aritzia. Our in-house bistro and cafe is a private oasis where employees can enjoy curated, subsidized Everyday Luxury dining.
The SET ‚Äî Our in-office fitness studio and gym with state-of-the-art equipment, custom-created classes and optional personal training. Open 7 days a week, it works out well.
Aritzia Virtual Wellness ‚Äî Because your health, happiness and safety matter, we provide 24/7 resources to support you in your wellbeing goals, whether they‚Äôre physical, mental, social or financial.
Aspirational Workplace ‚Äî Our offices are specially designed to be spaces of creativity, productivity and inspiration. They‚Äôre also dog friendly. Woof.
Amenities ‚Äî Additional amenities include a private parent‚Äôs room, shower facilities with elevated complementary conveniences, bike rooms and more.
The Extras ‚Äî We also offer a multitude of other perks like dry-cleaning, hotel and restaurant discounts, self-care promos and on-site medical care.

Title: Senior Product Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Product Data Analyst




Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work¬Æ Institute and recognized as a ‚ÄòCool Vendor‚Äô and a ‚ÄòVendor to Watch‚Äô by Gartner.




Please visit Fractal | Intelligence for Imagination for more information about Fractal.




Position Overview:

Fractal is seeking an experienced and highly influential Senior Product Data Analyst. This is a client facing role where you will be a key strategic partner to product managers, engineers, and designers, using data to shape the future of our client‚Äôs products. You will be responsible for defining and analyzing metrics that measure success, conducting deep-dive analyses to uncover critical insights and opportunities, and driving a culture of data-informed decision-making. The ideal candidate is a master of their craft, possessing deep technical skills combined with strong business acumen and the ability to translate complex data into a compelling narrative that inspires action and drives product strategy.




Roles and Responsibilities:

Strategic Product Partnership:

Act as the primary data science partner for a core product area, influencing product strategy and roadmaps with data-driven insights.
Define and own the key performance indicators (KPIs) and measurement frameworks to evaluate product performance, user engagement, and the success of new features.
Lead proactive, in-depth analyses to identify and size new opportunities, understand ecosystems, and model the potential impact of product changes.
Translate ambiguous business questions into structured analytical problems, delivering actionable recommendations that drive tangible business outcomes.




Advanced Analytics & Experimentation:

Design, execute, and analyze complex A/B and multivariate tests to optimize user experience, drive growth, and validate product hypotheses.
Develop sophisticated statistical models (e.g., predictive, clustering, causal inference) to understand user behavior, segmentation, and lifetime value.
Conduct deep-dive investigations into user journeys and product funnels to identify pain points and areas for improvement.
Build and maintain robust, automated dashboards and reporting systems to provide visibility into product health and performance for stakeholders at all levels.




Technical Leadership & Mentorship:

Champion data best practices and raise the bar for data quality and analytical rigor across the organization.
Collaborate with Data Engineering to design and build scalable, high-quality data pipelines and data models that support analytical needs.
Mentor junior analysts and other team members, providing guidance on analytical techniques, experimental design, and technical skills.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and broader cross-functional teams, effectively communicating the "so what" behind the data.




Mandatory Technical Skills:

Expert-Level SQL: Demonstrated mastery of SQL for complex querying, data manipulation, and performance optimization across large, complex datasets.
Statistical Programming: High proficiency in a statistical programming language such as Python (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn) or R.
Data Visualization & BI Tools: Extensive experience creating impactful visualizations and dashboards using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar.
Experimentation & Statistical Analysis: Deep understanding of experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate testing), statistical significance, and causal inference techniques.
Data Modeling: Experience with data modeling concepts and working with data warehouses (e.g., BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).




Mandatory Non-Technical Skills:

Strong Product Sense & Business Acumen: A deep curiosity and ability to understand the "why" behind user behavior and connect data insights to business goals and product strategy.
Exceptional Communication & Storytelling: The ability to distill complex analytical concepts into clear, concise, and compelling narratives for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Leadership & Influence: Proven ability to influence and lead without direct authority, driving consensus and action from cross-functional teams and senior leadership.
Strategic & Critical Thinking: The ability to think strategically, solve ambiguous problems, and move from data to insights to actionable recommendations.
Autonomy & Proactiveness: A self-starter who can manage complex projects from inception to completion with minimal oversight.




Education Qualification and Certifications Required:

Bachelor's, Master's, or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.
5-7+ years of experience in a data analytics or data science role with a significant focus on product analytics.
A strong portfolio of projects demonstrates the ability to use data to drive product decisions and business impact.




Pay:

The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Fractal, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is: $80,000 - $140,000 CAD In addition, you may be eligible for a discretionary bonus for the current performance period.




Benefits:

As a full-time employee of the company or as an hourly employee working more than 30 hours per week, you will be eligible to participate in the health, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability plans in accordance with the plan documents, which may be amended from time to time. You will be eligible for benefits on the first day of employment with the Company. In addition, you are eligible to participate in the Company 401(k) Plan after 30 days of employment, in accordance with the applicable plan terms. The Company provides for 11 paid holidays and 12 weeks of Parental Leave. We also follow a ‚Äúfree time‚Äù PTO policy, allowing you the flexibility to take the time needed for either sick time or vacation.




Fractal provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Senior Product Data Analyst


Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work¬Æ Institute and recognized as a ‚ÄòCool Vendor‚Äô and a ‚ÄòVendor to Watch‚Äô by Gartner.


Please visit Fractal | Intelligence for Imagination for more information about Fractal.


Position Overview:

Fractal is seeking an experienced and highly influential Senior Product Data Analyst. This is a client facing role where you will be a key strategic partner to product managers, engineers, and designers, using data to shape the future of our client‚Äôs products. You will be responsible for defining and analyzing metrics that measure success, conducting deep-dive analyses to uncover critical insights and opportunities, and driving a culture of data-informed decision-making. The ideal candidate is a master of their craft, possessing deep technical skills combined with strong business acumen and the ability to translate complex data into a compelling narrative that inspires action and drives product strategy.


Roles and Responsibilities:

Strategic Product Partnership:

  • Act as the primary data science partner for a core product area, influencing product strategy and roadmaps with data-driven insights.
  • Define and own the key performance indicators (KPIs) and measurement frameworks to evaluate product performance, user engagement, and the success of new features.
  • Lead proactive, in-depth analyses to identify and size new opportunities, understand ecosystems, and model the potential impact of product changes.
  • Translate ambiguous business questions into structured analytical problems, delivering actionable recommendations that drive tangible business outcomes.


Advanced Analytics & Experimentation:

  • Design, execute, and analyze complex A/B and multivariate tests to optimize user experience, drive growth, and validate product hypotheses.
  • Develop sophisticated statistical models (e.g., predictive, clustering, causal inference) to understand user behavior, segmentation, and lifetime value.
  • Conduct deep-dive investigations into user journeys and product funnels to identify pain points and areas for improvement.
  • Build and maintain robust, automated dashboards and reporting systems to provide visibility into product health and performance for stakeholders at all levels.


Technical Leadership & Mentorship:

  • Champion data best practices and raise the bar for data quality and analytical rigor across the organization.
  • Collaborate with Data Engineering to design and build scalable, high-quality data pipelines and data models that support analytical needs.
  • Mentor junior analysts and other team members, providing guidance on analytical techniques, experimental design, and technical skills.
  • Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and broader cross-functional teams, effectively communicating the "so what" behind the data.


Mandatory Technical Skills:

  • Expert-Level SQL: Demonstrated mastery of SQL for complex querying, data manipulation, and performance optimization across large, complex datasets.
  • Statistical Programming: High proficiency in a statistical programming language such as Python (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn) or R.
  • Data Visualization & BI Tools: Extensive experience creating impactful visualizations and dashboards using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar.
  • Experimentation & Statistical Analysis: Deep understanding of experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate testing), statistical significance, and causal inference techniques.
  • Data Modeling: Experience with data modeling concepts and working with data warehouses (e.g., BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).


Mandatory Non-Technical Skills:

  • Strong Product Sense & Business Acumen: A deep curiosity and ability to understand the "why" behind user behavior and connect data insights to business goals and product strategy.
  • Exceptional Communication & Storytelling: The ability to distill complex analytical concepts into clear, concise, and compelling narratives for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Leadership & Influence: Proven ability to influence and lead without direct authority, driving consensus and action from cross-functional teams and senior leadership.
  • Strategic & Critical Thinking: The ability to think strategically, solve ambiguous problems, and move from data to insights to actionable recommendations.
  • Autonomy & Proactiveness: A self-starter who can manage complex projects from inception to completion with minimal oversight.


Education Qualification and Certifications Required:

  • Bachelor's, Master's, or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.
  • 5-7+ years of experience in a data analytics or data science role with a significant focus on product analytics.
  • A strong portfolio of projects demonstrates the ability to use data to drive product decisions and business impact.


Pay:

The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Fractal, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is: $80,000 - $140,000 CAD In addition, you may be eligible for a discretionary bonus for the current performance period.


Benefits:

As a full-time employee of the company or as an hourly employee working more than 30 hours per week, you will be eligible to participate in the health, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability plans in accordance with the plan documents, which may be amended from time to time. You will be eligible for benefits on the first day of employment with the Company. In addition, you are eligible to participate in the Company 401(k) Plan after 30 days of employment, in accordance with the applicable plan terms. The Company provides for 11 paid holidays and 12 weeks of Parental Leave. We also follow a ‚Äúfree time‚Äù PTO policy, allowing you the flexibility to take the time needed for either sick time or vacation.


Fractal provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: BI & Systems Analyst
Description:
We are currently looking for a BI and Systems Analyst for our client based out of Toronto area.

Duration: 12-18 month contract




Scope of role:

BI Analyst: use their experience to elevate the BI organization to the next level of success by providing data-driven decisions and recommendations. You will work on improving reports and utilizing them to respond to any queries or issues. This position ensures the successful transmission of data from both internal and external systems, validates received data, and creates operational data models from multiple data feeds for on-demand reporting. Establish controls to ensure data validity and develop processes to automate these tasks.




Systems: Responsible for supporting the company in various IT applications and programs, primarily the finance system used daily. Ensure the system is functional and error-free, respond to all incidents, security concerns, and possible optimizations and additions.




‚Ä¢ Manage and support the company‚Äôs finance system ensuring it is functional and error-free.

‚Ä¢ Manage and support any other systems or applications as assigned, providing proper troubleshooting.

‚Ä¢ Maintain documented IT processes.

‚Ä¢ Interact with vendors and escalate to vendor support when necessary for resolution.

‚Ä¢ Provide IT security support and training, create and adopt policies, and work on strengthening the security and compliance department.

‚Ä¢ Conduct training sessions, write manuals, and provide constant refreshers to the organization on these systems.

‚Ä¢ Respond to and manage any internal/external audits, ensuring process integrity, IT compliance, policy support, and proper documentation.

‚Ä¢ Meet month-end reporting needs and consistently provide new and innovative reports using SQL, Excel, and InfoLease.

‚Ä¢ Process reporting requirements from various business groups and coworkers.

‚Ä¢ Maintain data lineage for elements in the reporting environment.

‚Ä¢ Conduct data profiling, create design documents, and define KPI logic.

‚Ä¢ Create rich visualizations to communicate complex ideas to business leaders, making data-driven stories come to life through visuals.

‚Ä¢ Provide technical and administrative support for the enterprise analytics system.

‚Ä¢ Lead and manage the company‚Äôs big projects involving IT, data, and compliance.

‚Ä¢ Manage and support any IT needs such as upgrades, maintenance, new modules, or products. You may be required to work some weekends.




Requirements:

‚Ä¢ A degree in Information Systems, Mathematics, Business, or a related technical field and/or equivalent experience and certification.

‚Ä¢ 3+ years of related experience in Business Intelligence: progressive experience in data service role within financial services industry.

‚Ä¢ Expert knowledge of SQL databases and SQL in at least one of the following environments: Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, or MySQL.

‚Ä¢ Strong experience in Excel and managing multiple data sheets.

‚Ä¢ Experience working with Microsoft Power BI.

‚Ä¢ Ability to write policies and procedures within IT and BI departments.

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience leading projects individually- is nice to have

‚Ä¢ Experience in IT security and cyber security or previous IT role- is nice to have

‚Ä¢ Extremely strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

‚Ä¢ Strong verbal, written, and visual presentation skills.

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop, host, and present training sessions.

‚Ä¢ Structured thinker and effective communicator, comfortable interacting with customers.

‚Ä¢ Experience designing, modeling, and implementing data solutions to meet business needs.

‚Ä¢ Self-motivated and self-learning, able to work independently with minimal supervision.

‚Ä¢ Proven experience designing, developing, and implementing new technology.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst with an advanced degree to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.




In this role you will need to hold an expert level of mathematical reasoning- a completed or in progress Masters/PhD is preferred but not required. Other related fields include, but are not limited to: Applied Math and/or Computer Science.




Benefits:

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
You‚Äôll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
You can work on your own schedule
Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work




Responsibilities:

Give AI chatbots diverse and complex mathematics problems and evaluate their outputs
Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance




Qualifications:

Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)
Detail-oriented
Proficient in arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, probability, statistics, and inductive/ deductive reasoning
A current, in progress, or completed Masters and/or PhD is preferred but not required




Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you.
