Title: Data Analyst, Enterprise
Description:
PENN Entertainment, Inc. is North America‚Äôs leading provider of integrated entertainment, sports content, and casino gaming experiences. From casinos and racetracks to online gaming, sports betting and entertainment content, we deliver the experiences people want, how and where they want them.

We‚Äôre always on the lookout for those who are passionate about creating and delivering cutting-edge online gaming and sports media products. Whether it‚Äôs through ESPN BET, Hollywood Casino, theScore Bet Sportsbook & Casino, or theScore media app, we‚Äôre excited to push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible. These state-of-the-art platforms are powered by proprietary in-house technology, a key component of PENN‚Äôs omnichannel gaming and entertainment strategy.

When you join PENN Entertainment‚Äôs digital team, you‚Äôll not only work on these cutting-edge platforms through theScore and PENN Interactive, but you‚Äôll also be part of a company that truly cares about your career growth. We‚Äôre committed to supporting you as you expand your skills and explore new opportunities.

With locations throughout North America, you can build a future at PENN Entertainment wherever you are. If you want to challenge conventions in gaming, media and entertainment, we want to talk to you.

About The Role & Team

On the Data Intelligence team at theScore, our mission is to develop high-quality and sustainable data-driven solutions to improve profitability, growth and the user experience. As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll work with all the key stakeholder groups to help them leverage data to track performance, make better decisions and ultimately reach their goals. The ideal candidate has strong communications skills, a passion for data, a background in quantitative analysis and an interest in professional sports, betting & eSports.

About The Work

As a key member of our Analytics team you will:


Build dashboards & develop backend capabilities of our Data Exploration tools (Mode, Looker, dbtCloud)
Foster adoption of our data exploration tool across the organization
Liaise with business stakeholders to identify data driven projects and opportunities.
Perform deep dive analysis using appropriate advanced analytics techniques to give business insights & recommendations
Critique existing workflows & data pipelines to identify opportunities for optimization or improved efficiency
Work with several stakeholder teams (listed below) to design, test and analyze user behavior data on our apps & websites
Has experience working with Fraud & AML, Responsible Gaming, Content, Sales, Operations or the Executive Suite
Design, create, execute and measure results from A/B and multivariate testing.
Liaise with data engineers to build data pipelines and solve related issues.
Continuously improve analytics implementation and adapt to changing technologies.
Stay on top of emerging trends in the digital industry.


About You


University degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business, or related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis.
Strong knowledge of relational databases and SQL.
A passion and curiosity for solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.
Ability to take complex data and present it in a clear and simple manner.
Ability to focus in a fast paced environment and multitask.
Experience with BI tools such as Looker, Mode, Periscope, ThoughtSpot, Tableau etc.
Experience with dbt Core or dbtCloud is extremely helpful but not required
Familiarity with analysis tools; R or Python packages are preferred.
Excellent written and oral communications skills.


What We Offer


Competitive compensation package
Fun, relaxed work environment
Education and conference reimbursements.
Parental leave top up
Opportunities for career progression and mentoring others


Penn Interactive is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Penn Interactive provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus. Additionally, Penn Interactive provides best-in-class benefits to eligible employees. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. That‚Äôs why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality ‚Äì to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life.

Title: Associate, Data Analyst - 2026 Start
Description:
161 Bay Street (93021), Canada, Toronto,Toronto, Ontario,

Associate, Data Analyst - 2026 Start

About Capital One Canada.

For over 20 years, we‚Äôve been on a mission to change banking for good and build relationships by making credit accessible, simple, intuitive and rewarding. We want to help Canadians succeed with credit, because we believe in people ‚Äî in our customers, in our associates, and in talent like you!

About The Team

Capital One is more than you think. We're a data-driven tech company that just happens to do credit cards. We focus on customer-first solutions, and we're united with this common goal. We have all the advantages of a startup, with the resources of a big company. Working here means you're curious, innovative spirit will be encouraged as you push boundaries and try new things, while your career is nurtured and supported. Our environment is creative and filled with teams that are passionate about the dynamic work they're doing. We're ahead of other banks in tech and we want to keep it that way.

About The Role

As a Data Analytics Associate, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop tools and data structures. As a creative problem-solver, you will be challenged to consider multiple options and select the optimal solution to meet the needs of your customers. You will own the recommendation and resolution to an existing business problem and will be involved end to end, from problem identification to solution deployment.

Your Responsibilities:


Transform data into data structures in our data lake and Snowflake data warehouse that are leveraged for business decision making
Create, enhance and maintain critical data processes
Act as a steward for our data: ensuring it is high quality, trustworthy, well documented, and easy to use
Build, automate, and maintain critical business reporting and visualizations that helps deliver insights
Perform investigative analysis on large/diverse datasets


Basic Qualifications:


Will have obtained a Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher from April 2026 to September 2026
Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or another quantitative discipline with a strong programming background
Familiarity with SQL and/or data transformation tools such as dbt. Python experience would also be an asset
Experience building and maintaining data pipelines
Ability to shape and develop requirements into practical solutions
Ability to clearly explain technical terms to a non-technical audience
Experience in a Unix/Linux environment, with Git, AWS, or APIs
Excellent verbal and written communication skills


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with backend technologies such as GoLang, AWS Lambda, S3.
Experience with version control technology i.e. Git
Experience with Jenkins CI/CD, microservices, API design / integration


Working at Capital One.

Enjoy a hybrid work environment, with 3 days in the office. Build a comfortable workspace with our one-time, Work From Home allowance and enjoy our head office located conveniently across the street from Union Station.

Live well‚Äîphysically, financially and emotionally. Receive support for you and those who are most important to you, with full coverage for spouses, domestic partners, and dependents. With up to $3000 in mental health coverage and up to $5000 in tuition subsidies per year‚Äîand much more‚Äîyou‚Äôll discover that Capital One is committed to helping you live your best life.

Capital One Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.

For technical support or questions about Capital One‚Äôs recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com.

Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site.

Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).

We may use your information for automated decision making. We may, for certain purposes, render a decision based exclusively on automated processing of your personal information as a part of the candidate screening process.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Level Access is the category leader in digital accessibility, combining SaaS and professional services to help organizations make the digital world more inclusive! With over $100M in ARR and growing, we serve global enterprise and public sector customers with critically important solutions. As we scale to meet ambitious goals in North America, the public sector, and European markets, we‚Äôre investing in the kind of world-class marketing organization that can drive this growth!

We‚Äôre seeking a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about data, storytelling, and operational excellence. This is a pivotal role responsible for marketing analytics and reporting across all channels and programs. You will be the go-to expert on marketing performance data‚Äîhelping us understand what‚Äôs working, what‚Äôs not, and where to invest to maximize return on investment.

You‚Äôll work multi-functionally with partners in Marketing, Revenue Operations, and Systems, and be trusted to turn complex data into clear insights that fuel decision-making and pipeline acceleration.

Role and Responsibilities


Own the end-to-end development of marketing dashboards and reporting across campaigns, programs, channels, funnel stages, and pipeline creation
Build and maintain SQL-based datasets and reports from Salesforce, HubSpot, and Google Analytics
Analyze marketing performance metrics (e.g., lead generation, conversion rates, channel attribution, ROMI) and deliver actionable insights
Partner with Revenue Operations and Marketing stakeholders to support pipeline planning, forecasting, and coverage analysis
Identify data gaps and opportunities to improve reporting processes, data integrity, and automation
Drive a culture of measurement and optimization within the marketing org


Qualifications


2‚Äì4 years of experience in marketing analytics, business intelligence, or marketing operations, ideally in a B2B SaaS environment
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (Power BI, QuickSight, or similar)
Deep understanding of marketing funnels, pipeline development, and performance metrics
Experience working with Salesforce CRM; familiarity with Hubspot and Google Analytics a plus
Demonstrable ability to translate data into clear insights and compelling narratives for stakeholders
Thorough, self-motivated, and adaptable to a fast-paced environment


Nice to Have


Familiarity with marketing attribution modeling or campaign influence frameworks
Experience supporting public sector or international marketing initiatives
Background in professional services, enterprise sales, or account-based marketing analytics


Application Process

This is a full-time salaried position with a competitive benefits package, including bonus opportunities and unlimited vacation/FTO. Salary is commensurate with experience.

Level Access is committed to workforce diversity. Equal Opportunity Employer. Copyright 2025, Level Access. All rights reserved.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Company: The Driving Force Group of Companies
Description:
The Driving Force Group of Companies is a network of world-class transportation and fleet management solutions companies. We‚Äôre proud to be an Alberta success story that began in a rented office above a small service station. With a can-do attitude and people-first culture, we‚Äôve grown into an industry leader, operating across Canada and the United States, spanning over 40 locations with over 600 + employees.




We‚Äôre looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team at our Edmonton corporate office.




What You‚Äôll Do

Create and maintain a large repository of reports/dashboards
Coordinate with internal and/or external stakeholders to capture requirements and provide input on optimal data insights
Use analytical techniques to inspect and sort data into a useful format and create reports and visualizations that help solve business problems
Work with business and finance teams to build our metrics to measure the impact of changes or to better surface information to decision-makers
Maintains current knowledge of industry and business trends through communication with professional organizations, suppliers, customers, competitors, and other informed individuals
Adopt, implement, and effectively evolve report automation standards
Performs other related duties as assigned




What You Bring

3+ years transforming data into dashboards or other self-serve insights
Advanced SQL: complex joins, window functions, performance tuning
Solid grasp of data-warehouse concepts: dimensional modeling, slowly changing dimensions, ELT pipelines
Hands-on with at least one modern BI/visualization platform (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, etc.)
Comfortable querying large cloud-scale datasets (Snowflake or similar)
Ability to translate technical findings into clear business narratives for non-technical stakeholders
Experience with AWS QuickSight and DTB for data transformation is a strong asset




What We Offer

The Driving Force Group of Companies combines numerous pay and benefit strategies to provide a comprehensive total rewards package. Any salary range displayed by a job board is an estimate. Your salary, which considers your unique qualifications and experience, is just one component of the robust total rewards you'll enjoy at The Driving Force Group of Companies. This may include annual discretionary bonus, benefits and wellness programs, RSP matching program, and multiple career development programs. We support your wellbeing through our Thrive wellness program and we ‚ÄòCelebrate Great‚Äô through our rewards and recognition programs.




The Driving Force Groups of Companies values diversity and is committed to providing equal opportunities in the workplace. We invite applicants from qualified individuals of all backgrounds.




While we welcome all interested candidates, only those selected for an interview will receive further communication.




If you require accommodation during any part of the recruitment process, please let us know.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital Marketing
Description:
VoiceTyper is currently expanding and looking to recruit a Data Analyst - Digital Marketing for a remote position. This position will be responsible for managing a portfolio of international search engine marketing accounts and conducting in-depth data analysis. Comprehensive training is provided. This is a full-time permanent position, working 37.5 hours per week, with alternative part-time arrangements available. The position is fully remote with occasional opportunities for in-person collaboration and meetings as preferred in Edmonton, Alberta.




Primary Responsibilities

Plan, implement, and manage a portfolio of international search engine marketing campaigns (Google Ads, Microsoft Advertising) to boost website traffic and drive conversions
Optimize and adjust campaign bids to maximize profitability and ensure peak performance
Analyze and interpret financial data and key performance indicators to uncover actionable campaign change tactics
Utilize internal reports to provide data-driven insights that enhance campaign effectiveness
Develop insightful, actionable reports to optimize performance from multiple angles
Conduct in-depth competitor and query research to identify optimization initiatives
Audit and review campaign structure details to improve efficiency and results
Experiment with writing new ad copy and craft compelling customer messages that convert
Build product level knowledge to evaluate opportunities
Review user level information and segment into audience lists for targeting purposes
Work with cross functional departments to execute projects




Knowledge and Skill Requirements

Post-secondary education in Business, Finance, Management Information Systems, Accounting, Operations Management, Marketing, Economics, other Analysis related programs or equivalent experience
Experience conducting analysis on large data sets
Strong self-direction and initiative with ability to work independently
Creative thinking and idea generation capabilities would be an asset
Excellent time management skills and the ability to balance multiple projects
Proficiency performing analysis using Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, Visualizations, Formulas)
Sound judgement and data driven decision making ability
Ability to summarize complicated analysis and make recommendations
Meticulous attention to detail and strong organization skills
Excellent written English communication skills and the ability to write short form advertising copy
Knowledge of PPC / SEM advertising platforms (Google Ads, Microsoft Advertising) would be an asset
Experience with C# would be an asset to be able to modify report generation code directly




Why You Should Join VoiceTyper

Competitive compensation package
Fully remote position - work from anywhere
Flexible work arrangements (full-time or alternative part-time option)
Great work life balance with flexible schedule
Direct impact on company growth and strategy
Collaborative and supportive team environment
Support in setting up a productive remote work setup - equipment is covered and co-working space memberships options are available
Co-working space membership available as preferred to
Opportunity to wear multiple hats and expand your skillset
Fast-paced, dynamic work environment




Company Profile

VoiceTyper is a fast growing small business based in Edmonton, Alberta, with a mission to revolutionize how people interact with technology using AI-powered speech recognition. As we continue to expand our local and international presence, we're looking for talented individuals who thrive in entrepreneurial environments and want to make a real impact. At VoiceTyper, you'll have the opportunity to shape our growth trajectory while developing your career in a supportive, remote-first culture that values excellence. If you're self-motivated, driven and ready to be part of our exciting journey, we want to hear from you!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
The Business Intelligence - Business Analyst is a key member of a centralized BI team supporting business operations. This role supports cross-functional business intelligence initiatives including data integration, reporting, automation, and ad-hoc analytics. The analyst will play a critical role in designing and developing customized data models and interactive reports that drive insight and strategic decision-making across departments and management structures. In additional this individual will support in the budgeting process and will be responsible for key deliverables to management while liaising with regional operations staff to ensure the best practice is maintained.

This position will be located in Winnipeg MB or Campbell River, BC

Your contributions to the team include:


Prepare, clean, and aggregate large data sets from multiple systems to support reporting and analytics needs
Develop and maintain customized, interactive reports and dashboards in Power BI and Excel
Support the annual budget process through data consolidation, report automation, and performance analysis
Perform financial and operational variance analysis, identifying trends, anomalies, and improvement opportunities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define reporting requirements and key performance indicators (KPIs)
Integrate data from various software solutions and APIs to enable centralized reporting and insights
Identify and resolve data quality issues, ensuring accuracy and consistency across systems and reports
Support the development of automated workflows and data pipelines to streamline recurring reporting tasks
Contribute to data governance practices and documentation of data models and reporting logic
Present findings and insights in a clear, visual format for both technical and non-technical audiences.


What you need to be successful:


Bachelor Degree in Business Administration, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field
Business analyst experience with enterprise-level software
Proficiency in Power BI and advanced Microsoft Excel (including Power Query, Dax)
Working knowledge of SQL and ability to query relational databases
Understanding of data modeling and ETL processes; experience connecting APIs or integrating third-party software data is a strong asset
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills
Clear and effective communicator, comfortable presenting complex data to non-technical audiences
Able to manage multiple tasks and projects independently and in collaboration
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric (Dataflows Gen2, OneLake, DirectLake, Etc.)
Exposure to Python of other scripting languages for data analysis or automation
Knowledge of real estate, construction, property management, or hospitality operations


The perks:


Employer paid extended health, vision, and dental coverage (including family)
Employee and Family Assistance Program
Yearly health and wellness benefit
RPP eligibility after one year
Employee recognition program
Company-provided cellphone
In-house professional development opportunities


Why Broadstreet?

Broadstreet Properties Ltd. is a family-owned and operated property management company, partnered with Seymour Pacific Developments, that manages multi-family residential communities. We are a growing organisation made up of diverse team members who are motivated to continuously innovate our approach to asset management. We consider employee well-being a priority and are dedicated to protecting the health and safety of our teams while ensuring a workplace that is respectful of everyone.

Broadstreet Properties Ltd. practices equal opportunity hiring and onboarding processes to ensure equal access and participation for everyone. We understand that we have a responsibility to ensure a safe, dignified, and welcoming environment, and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees irrespective of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other status protected by law. We believe in integrating people with disabilities into our workforce by removing barriers and meeting accessibility needs.

Title: IT Support Administrator
Description:
Project

The Woodfibre LNG Project is located approximately 7 km west-southwest of Squamish, British Columbia. It involves the construction and operation of a liquefied natural gas (LNG) export facility on the previous Woodfibre pulp mill site, which would have a storage capacity of 250,000 m3 and would produce approximately 2.1 million tons per year of LNG.

Woodfibre Management Ltd. is a privately held Canadian company based in Vancouver and a subsidiary of Pacific Energy Corporation Limited.

Position

The IT Support Administrator position is integral to Woodfibre LNG's dynamic team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with and provide your technical input to employees at all levels in the business on various technical topics. You will be a trusted partner in infrastructure implementations, upgrades, and fixes. You will be relied upon to continually contribute to industry best practices to improve department practices. You will play a key role in supporting the entire team across multiple locations in North America. The successful candidate reports directly to IT Manager, and this role is based in the Vancouver Office, BC.

Key Responsibilities:

The successful applicant will:


Level 1 support, be the first point of contact to provide IT assistance to multiple locations in North America
Manage IT support tickets daily (troubleshoot and resolve, escalate when necessary)
Operate desktop hardware/ software/mobile computing device configurations in accordance with Company standards and procedures
Work with Corporate IT in Asia to ensure that desktop standards are adopted, implemented, and maintained appropriately. In addition, to liaise with Corporate IT to resolve issues and requests
Escalate incidents and problems, as necessary, to the appropriate team, Site IT Delivery, or vendor, while actively retaining ownership of the incident on behalf of the customer
Manage vendors working on desktop maintenance/enhancements to ensure that services are being delivered and complete on time and within budgeted cost
Actively engage users when they report issues and notify users upon resolution
Be aware of service interruptions and follow up closely until resolution
Ensure appropriate levels of equipment spares are maintained across the business
Evaluate all Change Requests that impact users. User experience before and after implementation must not change and any change must be actively communicated and managed
Provide end-user training and preparation of the related materials
Create and maintain documentation for site IT operations support e.g., Desktop configuration documentation, end-user PC equipment deployment records and upkeep of knowledgebase related site IT operations issues
Upkeep and maintain an accurate record for site IT PC and equipment inventory
Other duties as assigned


Requirements

Required Experience:


Diploma in IT with at least 2-5 years of relevant experience
Working knowledge of:
LAN/MAN/WAN/VLAN, and VOIP technologies
Desktop/ laptop and printing hardware
Windows server technologies.
Windows 10, 11 configuration and troubleshooting
Familiar with Microsoft 365 and experienced in troubleshooting Outlook issues
Video Conferencing solutions
Supporting mobile device computing like Laptops, mobile phones, CCTVs, and IP phone systems
An understanding of:
VPN
Windows Active Directory and Microsoft Azure
Microsoft 365 Exchange mail server technologies
Security concepts and technologies
Cisco routers, switches, and network cable management
VR knowledge is strongly preferred.
Self-starter disciplined and worked under minimum supervision. Able to execute tasks independently
Customer service oriented / interactions with users. Possess excellent soft skills and be cost conscious
Understanding of how IT infrastructure and applications can support business processes and other software applications
Seek opportunities, develop, and maintain knowledge. Receptive to performance and developmental feedback


Additional Requirements:


Ability to efficiently multi-task and be self-motivated while working with others
Ability to remain cool and controlled in a crisis and when under pressure
Ability to convey information to both a technical and non-technical audience
Experience working with large multi-disciplinary teams, contractors in a multicultural environment is an asset.
Communication/interpersonal skills - to be able to interact with front line workers through to management and all hierarchical levels.
Accepts responsibility and demonstrates commitment to delivery of tasks and targets
Ability to work well under pressure and handle multiple tasks and changing priorities within tight time frames
Demonstrates and seeks accountability within team.
Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment
Expertise with a variety of computer programs (e.g., Office 365, MS Teams)
Motivated and willing to take ownership of tasks
Energetic in pursuit of continuous improvement processes
Shares knowledge readily and encourages personal development
A valid driver's license and passport
Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
The position is based in the Company's Vancouver Office with possible opportunity to travel to the Squamish, BC (Project Site) and EPC contractor's Office in Houston, as required to provide technical support.
Show more

  • Evaluate all Change Requests that impact users. User experience before and after implementation must not change and any change must be actively communicated and managed
  • Provide end-user training and preparation of the related materials
  • Create and maintain documentation for site IT operations support e.g., Desktop configuration documentation, end-user PC equipment deployment records and upkeep of knowledgebase related site IT operations issues
  • Upkeep and maintain an accurate record for site IT PC and equipment inventory
  • Other duties as assigned

Requirements

Required Experience:

  • Diploma in IT with at least 2-5 years of relevant experience
  • Working knowledge of:
    • LAN/MAN/WAN/VLAN, and VOIP technologies
    • Desktop/ laptop and printing hardware
    • Windows server technologies.
    • Windows 10, 11 configuration and troubleshooting
    • Familiar with Microsoft 365 and experienced in troubleshooting Outlook issues
    • Video Conferencing solutions
    • Supporting mobile device computing like Laptops, mobile phones, CCTVs, and IP phone systems
  • An understanding of:
    • VPN
    • Windows Active Directory and Microsoft Azure
    • Microsoft 365 Exchange mail server technologies
    • Security concepts and technologies
    • Cisco routers, switches, and network cable management
  • VR knowledge is strongly preferred.
  • Self-starter disciplined and worked under minimum supervision. Able to execute tasks independently
  • Customer service oriented / interactions with users. Possess excellent soft skills and be cost conscious
  • Understanding of how IT infrastructure and applications can support business processes and other software applications
  • Seek opportunities, develop, and maintain knowledge. Receptive to performance and developmental feedback

Additional Requirements:

  • Ability to efficiently multi-task and be self-motivated while working with others
  • Ability to remain cool and controlled in a crisis and when under pressure
  • Ability to convey information to both a technical and non-technical audience
  • Experience working with large multi-disciplinary teams, contractors in a multicultural environment is an asset.
  • Communication/interpersonal skills - to be able to interact with front line workers through to management and all hierarchical levels.
  • Accepts responsibility and demonstrates commitment to delivery of tasks and targets
  • Ability to work well under pressure and handle multiple tasks and changing priorities within tight time frames
  • Demonstrates and seeks accountability within team.
  • Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment
  • Expertise with a variety of computer programs (e.g., Office 365, MS Teams)
  • Motivated and willing to take ownership of tasks
  • Energetic in pursuit of continuous improvement processes
  • Shares knowledge readily and encourages personal development
  • A valid driver's license and passport
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
  • The position is based in the Company's Vancouver Office with possible opportunity to travel to the Squamish, BC (Project Site) and EPC contractor's Office in Houston, as required to provide technical support.

Title: Business System Analyst
Description:
Dawn InfoTek Inc. is a professional IT consulting team that partners with major financial institutions, investment firms and government sectors. We have been dedicated to delivering cutting-edge consulting services and recruiting all levels of IT positions for our clients.




We are currently seeking competent individuals to fulfill the role of Senior Business System Analyst to join our dynamic team for our client, one of the major banks.




Location Address: Downtown Toronto, Ontario

Contract Duration: 6 months contract with possibility of extension

Hybrid: 2 days a week in office located in down town Toronto




Key Responsibilities:

Requirements gathering by joining application design solutioning sessions with our architecture, development,
Join daily agile meetings to work with product owner, the POD team members
Facilitate gathering and design sessions with multiple stakeholders to extract requirements, and turn them into use cases, user stories, sequence diagrams, etc. to meet development and stakeholder needs.
Bridge the gap between business and IT, ensuring common understanding and IT/Business alignment of both functional (for business needs) and non-functional requirements (such as reporting, performance, interfaces, and constraints.)
Document in JIRA and Confluence.
And work with Dev's for clarification




Required Skills:

7+ years of relevant working experience, with 3+ years of BSA experience, preferably within FI/banking
2+ years previous experience with bank online banking application
3+ years‚Äô experience in API applications and documentation (JASON, XML) for data mapping.
3+ years‚Äô experience within an Agile environment using JIRA/Confluence




Education:

Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field preferred

Title: Business and Performance Analyst (11747)
Description:
JOB INFORMATION

Requisition ID: 11747

Number of Vacancies: 1

Department: Light Rail Transit Operations Department (20000060) - Light Rail Transit Operations-Department (30000397)

Salary Information: $96,460.00 - $120,611.40

Pay Scale Group: 9SA

Employment Type: Regular (On-Site)

Weekly Hours: 35 Off Days: Saturday and Sunday Shift: Day

Posted On: August 22, 2025

Last Day to Apply: September 1, 2025

Reports to: Manager, Business and Performance




The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC), North America's third largest transit system and recognized as one of the top places to work in the GTA has introduced its new 2024-2028 TTC Corporate Plan - Moving Toronto, Connecting Communities which continues the TTC‚Äôs legacy of delivering service to hundreds of millions of customers a year. The TTC‚Äôs new vision and mission statements also help promote the many environmental, social equity and economic benefits that the TTC provides:

Vision: Moving Toronto towards a more equitable, sustainable, and prosperous future.

Mission: To serve the needs of transit riders by providing a safe, reliable, efficient, and accessible mass public transit service through a seamless integrated network to create access to opportunity for everyone.




The full Plan can be viewed on ttc.ca.




Career Opportunity

Looking for a new and exciting job opportunity? We are looking for a Business and Performance Analyst to join our Light Rail Transit Operations Team!




What You Will Do

Reporting to the Manager, Business & Performance, you will be responsible to support the Business and Performance team within LRT Operations by serving as the primary contact within the department for written communications. Ensuring internal and external reporting follows documented processes and practices as part of the Quality Management System. In addition, develop policies and standard operating procedures to enable the smooth integration of the new LRT mode within the TTC, which will consist of process mapping, documenting and validating current business processes and business requirements.

This involves the following:

Compose, finalize, and monitor all external correspondence between Metrolinx and TTC, including commercial letters and briefing materials.
Prepare and present progress reports and updates on LRT-related issues to senior management, including department heads and executives.
Liaise with department heads to ensure contractual changes are accurately reflected in TTC‚Äôs standard operating procedures and departmental plans.
Establish formal documentation methods to safeguard data integrity, records management, and institutional knowledge.
Assist Operations Coordinators with the technical writing of departmental plans (e.g., Resource Management Plan, Operator Communication Plan, Fare Revenue Protection Plan) as contractually required by Metrolinx.
Document business processes and develop procedures across TTC business units, including quality management, contract administration, and variation analysis.
Create process flowcharts, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and policies for new and existing operational and administrative processes in collaboration with stakeholders and support their implementation.
Lead or support QMS activities such as document control, change management, non-conformance resolution, and corrective actions.
Design report templates and collaborate with system owners to enable access to system data for TTC reporting needs.
Apply advanced statistical models and algorithms for trend analysis, root cause identification, and corrective action planning. Interpret results using both quantitative and qualitative methods.
Prepare progress reports, KPIs, presentations, and analytical summaries for senior management using integrated data analysis.
Analyze program data to identify areas for improvement, recommend corrective actions, and support implementation of efficiency initiatives.
Liaise with the Metrolinx Project Scheduler to validate TTC milestones and update internal schedules accordingly.
Develop process maps for all operational and functional areas within LRT Operations.
Maintain and update RACI matrices, ensuring stakeholder accountability.

As a TTC employee, you will be responsible for promoting a respectful work and service environment that supports diversity, inclusion, and is free from harassment and discrimination. You will help to build an inclusive and accessible work and service environment for all employees and customers and ensure the needs of employees and customers are accommodated in accordance with TTC‚Äôs commitments and obligations under the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC) and Related Orders, the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), and TTC‚Äôs policies.




What Skills Do You Bring

Apply analytical skills
Communicate in a variety of mediums
Create and deliver presentations in various formats
Create, document, and manage information and records
Demonstrate appropriate and effective interpersonal communications through various media
Engage in organizational development




What Qualifications Do You Bring

Completion of a university degree in a related discipline such as Business Administration, Journalism, Communications, or Engineering. A combination of education, training, and experience deemed equivalent will also be considered.
Demonstrated experience with, or the ability to quickly interpret, complex contractual documents such as Operating & Maintenance Agreements and Project Agreements.
Proven experience in documentation and process design techniques.
Familiarity with process improvement and project management methodologies.
Advanced working knowledge of personal computer applications, including Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, Microsoft Project, Microsoft Visio.
Strong track record in planning and conducting research and reviews.
Experience preparing assessment reports, business proposals, and cost-benefit analyses.
Ability to work collaboratively on the development and implementation of large, complex operational concepts.




What We Offer

Commitment to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture that promotes a sense of belonging and represents and reflects the needs of the communities we serve.
One of the great benefits of being a full-time TTC employee is becoming a member of TTC defined pension plan.
A comprehensive benefits package that covers health, dental, vision and more.
Support for professional development opportunities for all colleagues through a broad range of learning programs that include in-person and online training, leadership development, and support for colleagues‚Äô well-being.




Commitment to EDI

The TTC is committed to upholding the values of equity, diversity, anti-racism and inclusion in the delivery of its services and in its workplaces. The TTC is committed to fostering a diverse workforce that is representative of the communities it serves at all levels of the organization and supports an inclusive environment where diverse employee and community perspectives and experiences bring value to the organization. The TTC encourages applications from all applicants, including members of groups with historical and/or current barriers to equity, including but not limited to, Indigenous, Black and racialized groups, people with disabilities, women and people from the LGBTQIA+ community. The TTC values and supports an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment and selection process. Accommodations for applicants are available upon request throughout the recruitment and selection process, including for those who identify as having a disability. Please contact Talent Management at (416) 393-4570. Any info information received related to an accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

The TTC‚Äôs policy prohibits relatives of current TTC employees from being hired, assigned, transferred or promoted into positions, where there is a conflict of interest due to a relationship. Should you be selected for an interview, you will be required to disclose the name, relationship and position of any relative who is a current TTC employee.

We thank all applicants for their interest but advise only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Meter Data Agent
Description:
50670 - Mississauga - Rotation 6 months / 9 months

Hydro One is proud to be the largest electricity transmission and distribution provider in Ontario, serving nearly 1.5 million customers. We have a long history in the industry with our roots dating back over 110 years to 1906. Since then, we have worked to grow and evolve to meet the changing needs of our customers and communities across Ontario. Today, we‚Äôre focused on providing exceptional customer service and ensuring we are building safe communities where we live, work and play.

It‚Äôs an exciting time to join the team at Hydro One!

General Accountabilities


Interface with Metering Service Providers and Metered Customers regarding the provision of metering services, metering installations and metering data for the IESO/OEB administered Metered Customers.
Collect metering data and synchronize meter clock times to specifications as per the IESO Market Rules, OEB Settlement and Transmission/Distribution System Codes.
Receive notification of the registration of proposed metering installations, meter point documentation, proposed on-site procedures that could affect metering data collection, equipment failures and metering overall reconciliation.
Implement/apply IESO market validating, estimating and editing requirements to ensure accuracy of customer billing.
Apply substitution routines, or perform minor data estimation as defined by the IESO Market Rules, OEB Settlement and Transmission/Distribution System Codes and notify Metered Customers, as appropriate.
Report and document on customer power outages.
Interface with field staff, prior to commissioning of meter installations and commencement of meter data collection, remotely test and verify communication link and accuracy of meter data by comparing the data between the meter and MV90 billing software.
Monitor and follow up on equipment condition and status of each meter trouble call, the resolution, the associated response time and report results to Supervisor.
Participate in the periodic testing and verification of meters including overall reconciliation of metering installations from a data collection perspective.
Maintain the metering database and ensure the accuracy and confidentiality of the data contained therein.


Selection Criteria

Essential Knowledge


Requires knowledge of electrical principles, terminology, function and interpretation of electrical measuring instruments.
Requires knowledge of electrical metering devices to help field staff diagnose/solve problems.
Experience in working with data collection/settlement systems such as MV90/STAR/WEB/MMISPC/CSS and meter vendor software to setup and download customer interval load data would be an asset.
Requires knowledge of data processing and the principles of computer processing operations to understand programming operations and the effects of program faults.
Requires knowledge of mathematics and statistics to select and analyze data for tabular or graphic presentation.
Requires effective verbal and written communication skills to develop and implement training packages.
Requires knowledge of customer/class load patterns to be able to identify and report meter failures.
This knowledge is considered to be normally acquired through either a Grade XII education in a secondary school plus up to one year of further concentrated study, or the equivalent education.
Requires experience to be familiar with the different types of meters and their performance characteristics under various conditions.
Requires experience in computer operation, computer data conversion and database operation.
Requires technical experience in order to communicate with external parties on technical issues, software applications.
Requires experience in business practices and procedures in order to develop business processes and tools for the collection, processing and administration of metering data.
Requires experience in the day to day maintenance of record systems and office procedures.


At Hydro One we understand that the success and strength of our business rests with our people. When we develop their skills, we are investing in both their success and ours. To secure the best talent, we seek to create a workforce that reflects the diverse populations of the communities where we live and work and to create a culture based on safety, innovation and inclusiveness.

We are honoured to be recognized by Forbes in its list of Canada‚Äôs Best Employers for 2025.

Thank you for considering a career with Hydro One, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates. If you are having difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email careers@hydroone.com . Hydro One will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process.

Please note this email is only for accommodation requests. Resumes sent to this email address will not be considered.

"Employer of the year 2025"

Deadline: September 2, 2025

In the event you are experiencing difficulties applying to this job please consult our help page here .

We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Hydro One; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Engineer, Business Banking Credit Risk (12-month contract)
Description:
Requisition ID: 234098

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Global Business Banking Risk Analytics & Reporting, the Data Engineer will work closely with senior management, GRM colleagues, business line leads, and a diverse set of stakeholders to generate insights and deliver strategic recommendations. The incumbent will drive analyses, support oversight, and strategic thought leadership across Business Banking portfolios, segments and industries, ensuring business strategies, plans and initiatives are supported in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:


Monitor Business Banking portfolio indicators, proactively analyzing performance alongside macro-economic and external trends; collaborate with the Lending Policy and Governance and GRM colleagues to establish recommendations based on data-driven observations and analyses.
Contribute to the GRM team and stakeholders in designing and developing reusable, scalable data engineering solutions.
Ensure high attention to detail, code quality, and robust architecture, while effectively translating business requirements into automated data pipelines and workflows.
Utilize external data sources to enhance insights and improve model accuracy, while effectively communicating results and methodologies to stakeholders and team members.
Measure and monitor credit score and policy changes across the credit life cycle (adjudication, customer management and collections) with a focus on independent analysis of the risk-return trade-off.
Collaborate with GRM colleagues to improve portfolio monitoring and account management capabilities through integration of new models and frameworks.
Support annual strategic planning process through thought leadership on implications to KPIs and risk related metrics, based on business objectives and growth plans.
Enable and deliver analyses and strategy development for Business Banking Credit Risk initiatives related to Capital optimization and Risk Adjusted Return on Capital.
Execute day-to-day activities in a manner consistent with the Bank‚Äôs risk culture and the relevant risk appetite statement and limits. Communicate the Bank‚Äôs risk culture and risk appetite statement.
Create an environment in which his/her team pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.
Build a high performance environment and implement a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team.


Skills

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? - We'd love to work with you if you have:


Post-secondary education focused in Computer Science, Electrical/Computer/Software Engineering or Mathematics; Master‚Äôs degree preferred
5+ years of relevant work experience in data engineering or similar roles
5+ years of experience with Python, SQL, SAS
5+ years of hands-on experience working with GCP or other major cloud providers
Solid analytical skills with comfortability working with large amounts of information and translating data into clear and concise findings
Strong data engineering and data pipeline skills, with the ability to efficiently build data pipelines to support production ready models with Python and GCP
Experience using and implementing visualization tools such as Power Bi and/or Tableau is desirable
Knowledge of Business Banking products and services is an asset
Strong verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills, with strong ability to present recommendations in a client-facing setting
Exceptional problem-solving skills, with ability to manage ambiguity
Highly organized with proven ability to make decisions in time pressured environment
Bi-lingual English/Spanish is highly desirable


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. HTML:
Requisition ID: 234098

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Global Business Banking Risk Analytics & Reporting, the Data Engineer will work closely with senior management, GRM colleagues, business line leads, and a diverse set of stakeholders to generate insights and deliver strategic recommendations. The incumbent will drive analyses, support oversight, and strategic thought leadership across Business Banking portfolios, segments and industries, ensuring business strategies, plans and initiatives are supported in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Monitor Business Banking portfolio indicators, proactively analyzing performance alongside macro-economic and external trends; collaborate with the Lending Policy and Governance and GRM colleagues to establish recommendations based on data-driven observations and analyses.
  • Contribute to the GRM team and stakeholders in designing and developing reusable, scalable data engineering solutions.
  • Ensure high attention to detail, code quality, and robust architecture, while effectively translating business requirements into automated data pipelines and workflows.
  • Utilize external data sources to enhance insights and improve model accuracy, while effectively communicating results and methodologies to stakeholders and team members.
  • Measure and monitor credit score and policy changes across the credit life cycle (adjudication, customer management and collections) with a focus on independent analysis of the risk-return trade-off.
  • Collaborate with GRM colleagues to improve portfolio monitoring and account management capabilities through integration of new models and frameworks.
  • Support annual strategic planning process through thought leadership on implications to KPIs and risk related metrics, based on business objectives and growth plans.
  • Enable and deliver analyses and strategy development for Business Banking Credit Risk initiatives related to Capital optimization and Risk Adjusted Return on Capital.
  • Execute day-to-day activities in a manner consistent with the Bank‚Äôs risk culture and the relevant risk appetite statement and limits. Communicate the Bank‚Äôs risk culture and risk appetite statement.
  • Create an environment in which his/her team pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.
  • Build a high performance environment and implement a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team.

Skills

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? - We'd love to work with you if you have:

  • Post-secondary education focused in Computer Science, Electrical/Computer/Software Engineering or Mathematics; Master‚Äôs degree preferred
  • 5+ years of relevant work experience in data engineering or similar roles
  • 5+ years of experience with Python, SQL, SAS
  • 5+ years of hands-on experience working with GCP or other major cloud providers
  • Solid analytical skills with comfortability working with large amounts of information and translating data into clear and concise findings
  • Strong data engineering and data pipeline skills, with the ability to efficiently build data pipelines to support production ready models with Python and GCP
  • Experience using and implementing visualization tools such as Power Bi and/or Tableau is desirable
  • Knowledge of Business Banking products and services is an asset
  • Strong verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills, with strong ability to present recommendations in a client-facing setting
  • Exceptional problem-solving skills, with ability to manage ambiguity
  • Highly organized with proven ability to make decisions in time pressured environment
  • Bi-lingual English/Spanish is highly desirable

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior BI Analyst
Description:
Our client has an immediate opening for a Senior BI Analyst to join their team in Toronto on a 6 months contract with the possibility of further extension.




As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will impact business by fueling the best in class data analytics and reporting platform that will empower our business users in making data driven decisions and strategies in their everyday work. You‚Äôll work with users across the organization to understand how data helps them and translate that into solutions that will bring data from various systems into our data warehouse.




Responsibilities:




- Act as the liaison between business users and the BI team

- Work with analysts, data owners, product owners and report users to define business requirements and system goals

- Translate business requirements into technical specifications

- Coordinate with developer and end users on solution compatibility and user satisfaction

- Work on dashboarding and reports capability across businesses.

- Work closely with Engineering teams to make sure data integrity, management and best practices are followed.

- Make good judgements on solution scale and feasibility when faced with business requests

- Design unbiased testing strategy for projects

- Help BI team to define measures of success for projects and solutions

- Identify areas of improvements in BI solutions and propose value add for the team.




What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed




4+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst/Business Analyst in IT field
Expertise in BI tools such as Looker, PowerBI, Tableau
Must have Looker and ClickStream Data
Experience as an administrator of the above tools is a plus
Strong business acumen and understanding of business processes
In depth understanding of BI solution and platform
Knowledge of business data and able to tie it to process and operation
Intuition of solving business problems with systematic solutions
Outstanding communication skills in both technical and business terms

Title: GIS Technician
Description:
This page is for current employees only

To display this page you need a browser with JavaScript support.

Job Number

J0825-0744

Job Title

GIS Technician

Job Type

Permanent Full Time

Job Category

geographic information systems

Salary

$5,291.00 - $6,430.00/Month

Date Posted

August 22, 2025

Closing Date

August 28, 2025

Position Overview

The City of Prince Albert is looking to fill a permanent full time position of GIS Technician in the Community Development department. The GIS Technician is responsible to support GIS initiatives for all City departments. The GIS Technician will contribute to the development and implementation of data standards, assessing and managing a multitude of data sets and provide technical GIS support to internal and external partners.

Required Qualifications


Certificate or diploma in Geographic Information Systems (GIS).
Up to 1 year of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Class 5 driver‚Äôs license.


Key Knowledge, Technical Skills And Abilities


Demonstrated proficiency in ArcGIS Pro and ArcGIS Online.
Working knowledge of the principles, practices and techniques of GIS and related software applications.
Knowledge of GIS data analysis methods, understanding of GIS tool sets, file formats and digital compilation techniques.
Working knowledge of and ability to work efficiently with current operating systems, spreadsheet, word processing and database applications.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work independently and manage time and tasks effectively.


Principle Duties & Responsibilities


Key Duties:
Create, develop and maintain spatial and attribute databases.
Operate GIS related software and applications used to manipulate spatial and attribute data to produce spatial data products.
Maintain, update, and analyze both spatial and non-spatial data
Assist with research of models, methodologies, data sources, business and analytical tools to assist departments in meeting their operational and strategic goals.
Develop scripts, models or other methods to automate repetitive geoprocessing tasks used in data maintenance and the production of maps.
Develop and document procedures for data integrity, editing, import, conversion and management of spatial and attribute data.
Develop and/or deliver training to staff on geo-technical, GIS and web mapping products.
Plan map content, format and design and compile data based on departmental requirements.
Prepare digital, online and hard copy maps for distribution to internal staff, outside organizations and the general public.
Provide technical assistance to GIS-based application users.
Perform quality control reviews.
Liaise with other departments regarding special projects.
General Duties
Attend to all inquiries through personal, telephone, and written communication.
Follow acts, regulations, bylaws, agreements, policies and procedures.
Follow regulations, acts and policies of Occupational Health & Safety.
Perform other related duties as assigned.


See The Attached Document(s)

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Our client is seeking an Intermediate Data Engineer to join our lean, fast-moving, and dynamic team in an exciting industry. You‚Äôll work in a high-impact environment where data drives every decision. This role is ideal for someone who‚Äôs curious, self-directed, and thrives on solving complex problems without being spoon-fed answers.




Duties:

Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines using modern cloud data platforms
Integrate new data sources and ensure clean, reliable data flow into our data warehouse
Collaborate with analysts, product managers, and other stakeholders to understand data needs and translate them into engineering solutions
Monitor pipeline performance, resolve issues proactively, and document workflows
Optimize data models and queries for performance and usability
Work independently to identify inefficiencies, recommend improvements, and drive implementation
Maintain and enhance data governance and quality processes




Tech Stack:

Data Warehouse: Snowflake
Visualization: Tableau
Languages: SQL (required), Python (preferred)
Tools: Slack




Requirements:

2‚Äì4 years of experience as a data engineer, preferably in fast-paced or high-volume environments
Strong SQL skills and experience working with cloud-based data warehouses (Snowflake preferred)
Ability to work independently and figure things out with minimal guidance
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Strong sense of curiosity and initiative ‚Äî you enjoy digging into data and uncovering insights or issues
Comfortable working with ambiguity and shifting priorities
Clear communicator ‚Äî you can explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences

Title: Technology & Data Internship Program
Description:
Company Description

Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization

When you join CPP Investments, you are joining one of the world‚Äôs most admired and respected institutional investors. As a professional investment management organization, CPP Investments invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure its financial sustainability for generations of working and retired Canadians.

CPP Investments invests across regions and asset classes to build a globally diversified portfolio. It holds assets in public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure, and fixed income, and the CPP Fund is projected to reach $3.6 trillion in assets by 2050. The organization is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, S√£o Paulo, and Sydney.

CPP Investments successfully attracts, selects, and retains talented individuals from top-tier institutions worldwide. Join our team for access to:


Stimulating work in a fast-paced and intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
A hybrid-flexible work environment with an emphasis on in-person collaboration
A culture rooted in principles of integrity, partnership, and high performance
An organization with an important social purpose that positively impacts lives


If you have a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach work with the highest integrity, invest your career here.

Job Description

At CPP Investments, we are committed to helping you develop your skillset and gain world-class experience. We have leaders who listen to every member of the team and trust them with meaningful work. This translates into immediate and unparalleled learning.

The Technology & Data Internship Program was developed for undergraduate students who are highly analytical, interested in business issues and curious about career opportunities in technology and data within the finance industry. The program provides you access to a virtual classroom and on the job training where you will learn how to leverage your problem solving and technical skills to help make critical business decisions. You will be assigned both a manager and a mentor to help support your learnings from the classroom to apply in the workplace setting.

The program begins with a week-long Intern Orientation session for you to engage with fellow interns and learn about the programs available to you. You will advance your knowledge and expertise through skills-based training and on-the-job assignments. You will participate in additional programming such as our Speaker Series where each session focuses on a different aspect of our culture including employee resource groups, inclusion, and diversity and much more. We encourage you to bring your authentic self to work and take every opportunity to excel in your role to build your career at CPP Investments.

What‚Äôs in It for Me?

You will join us as a Junior Engineer Intern for the Winter of 2026 in the Technology & Data Department for a 4-month, 8-month or 12-month internship based on your availability. Upon completion of your term, you will be considered for a fulltime role.

As a Junior Engineer Intern, you will assist the team in:


Designing, coding, testing, delivering, and supporting systems, applications, or solutions to meet the evolving needs of business teams following an Agile delivery approach.
You‚Äôll also have the opportunity to learn and apply Java, Python, Angular, AWS and low code code/no code solutions.
You can consider the following roles:
Software Engineering: business aligned engineering teams that build systems and applications for front and back-office teams.
Data Engineering: are known as the institutional subject matter experts. The team is the center of data, technology, and business, assisting teams across the fund with data stacks, proof of concepts, logic, and analytics work bench.
Cloud Engineering: enables foundational cloud & AI services and shared capabilities for software engineering and business teams, driving cloud maturity and compliance.
Quality Engineering: are involved in the design and development of test automation in support of continuously monitoring application quality and to ensure rapid and reliable software delivery.


Qualifications

Candidates in an undergraduate program who are returning to school after their work term, are eligible to apply. We look for candidates with a strong track record of academic success while balancing extracurricular activities. You must have a strong interest in learning new technologies and finance, as well as possessing good communication, interpersonal and relationship-building skills. In addition, you will combine energy, enthusiasm, and intellectual curiosity, with a demonstrated interest in investing.

Additional Information

If you have an interest in working with talented professionals in the financial industry in an environment of integrity, partnership and high performance, then you should consider a career in at CPP Investments.

To apply, please include a cover letter, resume and transcripts (full unofficial version) by September 7, 2025 at 11:59pm EST.

Visit our Linkedin Career Page or Follow us on Linkedin.

At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.

Our Commitment To Inclusion And Diversity

In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Disclaimer

CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

Title: Help Desk Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Help Desk Analyst for a long-term position, starting with a 6-month contract, in Calgary, Alberta. This position is 100% on site. Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.




Role Description

We are currently looking for a Help Desk Analyst to join our client‚Äôs high-performance team of Help Desk professionals who deliver excellent technical support with a high degree of customer satisfaction and timeliness.




Responsibilities

Serve as the first point of contact for all IT-related issues, providing timely and effective resolution or escalating as necessary.
Respond to incoming support requests via phone, email, or in-person with a focus on excellent customer service.
Diagnose and troubleshoot hardware, software, and network problems.
Install, configure, and maintain desktops, laptops, and peripheral devices.
Collaborate with other IT teams to resolve complex technical issues.
Provide user training and guidance on IT-related topics, such as software applications, security best practices, and system usage.
Create and update documentation to assist end-users in solving common problems independently.
Log all support interactions and maintain detailed records of issues, solutions, and service requests using the help desk ticketing system.
Prioritize and escalate incidents based on urgency and impact.
Manage the procurement process for IT hardware and software, including obtaining quotes, negotiating with vendors, and placing purchase orders.
Manage user accounts, permissions, and access rights in accordance with security policies.
Participate in On-Call rotation for after-hours support.
Stay up to date on new technology trends, cyber threats, and vulnerabilities.




Required Skills and Experience

Minimum of 4-5 years of proven experience in a help desk or technical support role.
Proficient in troubleshooting Windows environments and basic understanding of networking concepts.
Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite (Microsoft Entra, Intune, Exchange Online) and Microsoft 365 Collaboration tools like SharePoint, Teams, and One Drive.
Strong understanding of the ITIL concepts is a must.
Familiarity with help desk ticketing systems and IT service management (ITSM) tools e.g. Freshservice is a plus.
Previous experience in IT procurement, including vendor management, negotiation, and purchase order processing would be desirable.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical users.
A customer-focused attitude with the ability to empathize and prioritize end-users' needs.







Please note that while all applications are appreciated, only candidates selected for interview will be contacted.




InSync Systems Inc. is a privately-owned boutique Canadian Resourcing and Consulting Services Company that works closely with a range of corporate clients across multiple industries to bring them solutions that effectively address their business needs.
